Reviews.Title: “Great looking, but the bed was too hard.”
Reviews.Author: fielin
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the Hotel Silken Diagonal in March. The hotel is spectacular, and very well located near a metro station. Everything is easily accessible. We really enjoyed the design. The lobby is beautiful, and the staff is great. We really felt welcome, and the check-in was a breeze. The place smells wonderful and looks clean. The room (standard room) was beautiful and we loved everything at first sight. We had a small problem with the TV, but maintenance was there in 5 minutes. They quickly discovered that everything was working properly, and that they only had to change the batteries in the remote controller. Nevertheless, they offered to upgrade us free of charge - we declined because we felt this would be abusing the system, but we honestly think that this summarizes the service at this hotel : efficient, and excellent. The restaurant is nice. We didn't try the breakfast, but the dinner was great. Much better than your average hotel-fare. The waiter was very talkative and very accommodating. This would make for a perfect hotel if... and that is a big if, for a hotel... if we had been able to sleep for the two nights we spent there. The bed was hard as a rock, very uncomfortable, and we spent two horrible nights waking up every hours and two awful days feeling exhausted. I have never thought about us as picky. To be honest we have slept in beds so old that they had holes in the center, and never complained. This is the first time I feel I cannot sleep because of how hard the bed is. I've never seen this problem mentionned in all the critics on Tripadvisor, so I guess this is just us, and this bed was just not the right one for us. And it's a shame, really, because we loved this hotel so much. But I would not go back, nor would I recommend it to my friends and family : an hotel where you cannot sleep is not a hotel you want to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location - value for money”
Reviews.Author: sarah d
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with friendly staff and in a good location. The hotel itself is very nice and modern with great views from the rooftop of the mountains, Torre agbar and sagrada de familia. We had a room on the 8th floor and this was really comfortable, although there wasn't any complimentary water or fruits offered as you might get in some hotels, the bathroom was nice and clean, had the usual toiletries offered in a 4* hotel. The room was cleared and replenished with new towels and mini bar items everyday. We didn't actually eat at the hotel, but at the food court in the shopping centre called Glories, this is just across the road. There is also a supermarket here if you need to get some water or any basics. For travel we bought a 10 trip card for 9 euros, this can be used on the metro, tram and buses, all these transport links are 5 mins walk from the hotel and are really easy to use, you can also get to and from the airport using this metro card on train. The hotel is only 4 stops away from plaza catalunya where you can walk down las ramblas, or you can get the tram down to the beach which takes 5 to 10 mins and the hotel is also 5 to 10 mins away from sagrada de familia by metro. I thought that the location of the hotel was really good because it’s just outside the touristy areas but still easily accessible and the staff here are very friendly, would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and great location”
Reviews.Author: lunnelli
Reviews.Content: A very trendy hotel with modern furniture and decoration. It's located right next to the Agbar Tower which served as a great landmark especially at night - you just won't miss it. Staff was helpful too. The safe was broken in the first room we were assigned to and we were switched to another room swiftly. We spent the new year's eve at this hotel and managed to participate in the countdown from the hotel room with the crowd outside Agbar Tower. It was fun memorable!

Reviews.Title: “a modern and trendy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: champsak
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights we found this hotel to be very modern and clean. The location of the hotel isn't in the centre but you can get to most places really quickly as the metro station is 2 min away from the hotel and the Tram stop is just outside. The staff were friendly and helpful and the best part of this hotel must be the top floor which give you a good view of barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maurice P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 3 nights for €250 .. very pleasant, nicely kitted out. Slight downside was building work outside starting early, bed a fraction hard for my aching body ..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: ep185
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was lovely and we would definitely go back! Great location, a very short walk to the metro station. Also very near to a shopping centre. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is modern and very trendy. Have nothing to complain about from this stay and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for Business Travellers”
Reviews.Author: bscharin
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in the Silken Diagonal. The location itself is central but not in the city center. It's close to la Sagrada Familia and close to a metro station, so that works well. It's a very designish hotel but form definitely does not follow function in this case. E.g. the rooms are not carefully built, typical aspects of comfort like a coffee maschine or water boiler are missing, you don't find the tissues, showering waters inevitably the whole bathroom etc. Breakfast is OK but too expensive when not included in the room rate. I recommend everybody to cross the street as there is the gorgies shopping center with a food court and a lot of cafés over there where your breakfast will be fine and at a fraction of the hotel costs. I had a gin tonic at the hotel bar not careful enough to ask the price before I ordered and being charged 11,00 EUR for it blew me off. That's why I definitely decided to let you all know that this hotel experience is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy. Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Carmela C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend four years ago, and I loved it. The hotel looks very trendy and clean. The views are great, while the room is really nice and comfortable. However, the location seems to be geared towards business travelers than tourists. It is very close to the metro station, and there is a shopping mall across the street. The daily rate is on the higher end. If you're on a tight budget and you want good value for your money, look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel with shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: JimMcC999
Reviews.Content: Mywife and I stayed at the Silken Diagonal for five days in January 2012. We booked a suite on one of the top floor and found it extremely comfortable with great views although at the price it was expensive compared to others. There are automated high speed lifts. Barcelona itself is expensive for hotels when compared to other cities e.g Madrid, Seville, Cordoba and Granada and this reflects the Citiy's popularity as a tourist destination. The hotel is beside a modern building lit up at night which resembles the London Gherkin so it is difficult to miss. It is also very close (300 metres) to the Metro and convenient to several large shopping centres. The room was great if a little expensive. We were less impressed with the reception, the seating area and the restaurant which we think did not live up to the standard of the hotel. Service was poor and menus quite limited and expensive. Room service was extremely poor and slow. Overall it was not value for money and we would not return to this hotel despite the positive location and excellent room.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophie R
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the rooftop pool was great. However breakfast was expensive and it is a very long walk to the centre - not too far to the beach. Perhaps better suited to the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “poor quality bed for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abigail H
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful four day Valentines break in Barcelona. We stayed in the hotel Silken Diagonal as this appeared well recommended on trip advisor. However, word of warning to future travellers .... pack plenty of pain killers for your inevitable bad back should you choose to stay at this hotel. The hotel really needs to take on board the need for comfortable beds for city break travelers, for a four star hotel they need to make some changes to the quality of beds they are offering. Also we specifically requested a double or kingsize bed but had to push two single beds together!! Another point to mention, specially for us Brits who love our morning brew , there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room which we found most suprising for a four star hotel!!! As for Barcelona , this is a vibrant and diverse city and well worth a visit , bus tour is deffinately recommended. Final word of warning...watch out for the very experienced pickpockets especially along the la Ramblas!!!

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel, next to transportation means.”
Reviews.Author: Katerina8113
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with stylish rooms. Quite big double room, with glass window all over the wall and a very comfortable king sized bed, It was cleaned every day.The hotel is right next to the Torre Agbar, metro station Glories, bus stop and tram stop. Very helpful personel and clean environment. We had a serious problem with the heating due to the fact that the sun is all day in the room through the glass wall. They have a window roller blind but it is not enough. Unfortunately we did not taste the breakfast because it was quiet expensive (18euro/person) but just crossroad there is a big mall with supermarket and lot of choices of fast food.

Reviews.Title: “Silken Diagonal”
Reviews.Author: jphansen32
Reviews.Content: Very stylish hotel. Rooms with view over Barcelona, glass bathrooms, very good bed. Lobby with small but nice bar. Small pool and restaurant on top of the roof with a terrific view over Barcelona. People are young, friendly and service is good. From here you can go by tram to the city and to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....Had a Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy N
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the Silken for five days NYE 2012. We had a wonderful time. The Silken is a beautiful hotel and is centrally located. The hotel rooms are very modern and nice 7 out of 10. We did have an issue with the heating the first night but the maintence staff jumped right on it, The glass shower was a little disconcerting but we managed. Directly across the street is a mall with numerous retail stores, restaurants and a grocery store. The first couple days we took cab rides around the city until we learned how convenient the bus system is in Barcelona. The #7 bus has a stop across the street from the hotel and takes you directly to Las Ramblas the heart of the city....this is where we spent most of our time during our stay as there is so much to do in this area of the city. I highly recommend this hotel....I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “While staying in Bercelona - this is the Hotel to book.”
Reviews.Author: elena_antonova
Reviews.Content: If you do not want to have a feeling that you have overpaid for the hotel and have not got the expected value for the money you've paid - I really recommend you to stay at "Silken Diagonal". The liocation is good - 3 min walking distance from metro station Glories +3 or 4 stops to the very center of Barcelona.15-20 min walk (or 3 stops by metro) to Sagrada Familia. Tourist bus stop is just opposite the hotel dore across the road. We were using this bus during 2 days. This is the "City tour", absolutely the same logic as in London, by double deckers. Tickets and earphones are available on board. Excursions are provided in the majority of languages. In the bus you will get a small book with a lot of supplementary discounts for the sightseengs and restaurants/bars in Barcelona. Shopping Center Glories is situated in front of the hotel, also across the road. Honestly, I did not find "Glories" very interesting from shopping perspective :) but there are a lot of small restaurants and bars to stay in the evening if do not want to move away from the hotel. Our room was reasonably big and always clean. The beds were comfortable. Soundproofing is good. Interesting design of the hotel from inside. Just for the traveller information as this is not a unique set provided in the hotel of this level. Provided: shower gel, shampoo, soap, shaving set and AS lotion, shower cap, toothbrush/paste, comb, sponges. Not provided: slippers (indoor shoe). If I try to see where I can find the weaknesses - this is probably that reception is always busy - a lot of people. But I do not think this is the significant point. I definitely recommend this hotel for the tourists with and without children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for City Break”
Reviews.Author: wherewegoing71
Reviews.Content: The Silken Diagonal is an ideal place to stay for a city break. The location is a new modern business district, quiet with no street noise which means that sleep quality is very good. The hotel is walkable to Sagrada Familia (20 mins) city centre (45) but taxis are plentiful outside and reasonably priced in Barcelona which makes getting about affordable. The tourist bus stops opposite the hotel and the tickets can be conveniently bought at reception. The hotel is right next to the Torre Agbar tower which is beautiful at night lit up all different colours and can be viewed up close from the rooftop decking leisure area Floor 10. There is a small dipping pool up there also which would probably be very crowded in the high season. The tower is also useful if you are out walking as you can find your way back. We arrived for a break over New Year and found the reception very nicely decorated for the Festive Season and the staff at reception very helpful and friendly. We were instructed how to use the (3) lifts and if the instructions are followed the lifts are fast and easy to operate. The room itself was comfortable quite basic but the bed was large and very comfy. The bathroom was the weak link though - bath & shower quite awkward to operate and shower screen fixed which made it more so. We did not find the glass wall a problem at all (see other reviews) as there is a screen and the toilet cubicle itself is private, but we thought the glass bathroom door was a hazard so kept that open all the time in order not to walk into it. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as at 18 euros each its pricey, but there are several cafes & Starbucks just across the road at the Glories Mall and a large Carrefour supermarket where breakfast items could be found so plenty of choice. To conclude we intend to stay again at the Diagonal as we found it a lovely hotel, clean, modern and ideal as a base to explore the city and comfortable to return to after doing that. The Mall is very convenient for anything you need. The hotel would also be ideal for a business trip. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break at the Diagonal”
Reviews.Author: Lizilu20
Reviews.Content: We stayed from friday to sunday at the diagonal with friends and had a fab time. We booked flights and hotel via lastminute.com and got a fantastic deal. Less than £300 per couple for 2 nights, flights included. Hotel is in a good position within walking distance to Sagrada Familia. Other than that, we used taxis to get around in as we were 2 couples to share the cost. Cost of taxis to and from Las Ramblas varied depending which route the driver took. Anything from 6EU to 10EU. The taxi rank is at the side of the hotel, by the entrance to the Novotel next door. Las Ramblas is a must, but do not eat at the bottom end in the middle of the pedestrian walkway, where all the tables and chairs are as you will be severely ripped off like us if you do. We found that the best place for tapas and drinks if you want to stay on las ramblas was a restaurant (can't remember it's name unfortunately) at the Caralunya square end of las ramblas, right at the top on the right hand side (as you enter las ramblas, looking down towards the port). It's painted white in the shape of a castle and has tables and chairs outside as well as inside seating. Without a doubt, the tapas and paella were by far the best in quality and price and the service was excellent. One of the waiters was a wonderful lady called Susane, she was Spanish and spoke English with an American accent. She would'nt let me go home without giving me a present, a beautiful necklace, as she said I reminded her of her sister. We originally went for breakfast and ended up going back for lunch as the quality of the food was so good. We also ate in the surrounding streets at bars, the market, and down by the port/harbour. We nwver actually tried the food in the hotel although the menu looked good and reasonably priced for hotel food. We did take advantage of the mini bar in our room as again, the drinks were reasonably priced. We ate out a few times in the Glories shopping centre next to the hotel, breakfast in Starbucks one day and dinner at the Italian restaurant which was delicious and good value for money. If you stand outside the hotel and turn right down the main road, at the end of the Glories is a little tapas restaurant which was the best value for money, portion size and taste we had. The courses kept on coming and the bill for 4 people including a bottle of wine, water and 4 large beers was around 80 euros. Fantastic value for money and delicious food. Next to the hotel was a little bar run by a Chinese/Spanish family which was also excellent value for money, cheap booze and the food looked good and although we never ate there, we can defintely vouch for the vino tinto, blanco and beer. The hotel room was comfortable if not compact, but I found the bed quite hard and did not sleep very well. Working out the shower/bath was no mean feat and difficult to fill the bath unless you were standing inside it due to the unmoveable shower screen. The vies from the hotel roof were fantastic and the sight of the Torre Agbar lit up at night next to the hotel was something to behold. All in all, we had a fabulous weekend and woud definitely book the Silken Diagonal again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not central”
Reviews.Author: Lourenzo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and design. free wifi. close to metro station. The price I got did not include breakfast but we went there for the first breakfast. Good but 18 euros per person is way too much, as a result we did not use anymore. Girls at check-out very nice and eficient. Nice touch is the DJ at night, a shame there was not may people enjoy-it. Beds are too hard, very unconfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M
Reviews.Content: Good location, lovely rooms and good food. Excellent lighting in the room makes reading really easy for those oldies like me!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city break in a trendy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carla_hursty
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Thursday 17th Nov around 1430hrs. The reception were friendly, quick and efficient and has us checked in and in our room within ten minutes despite the fact that we were half an hour earlier than check in time. We stayed in room 424 which was a corner room with a view over the city and the Sagrada Familia. The view was amazing - we stayed four nights and I did not get bored of lookingout of the window!!! The room was fantastic. Very modern and stylish. The only downside was it was two beds pushed together.. The bathroom is seethrough but the toilet is in a seperate room which you cant see into at all. There is a flat screen TV which we didnt use. Our room was made off two large glass walls with electric blackout blinds that you operated by a switch next to the bed. I loved this - the view was great! There is a hairdryer provided in the room and a mini bar (pay for items you use) but we used the fridge to store drinks we bought in from outside. The hotel location was good. It is situated near to Clot underground station (five min walk) or Glories tram station (two minute walk). There was a shopping area opposite the hotel consisting of cafes, restaurants, shops and a supermarket. The hotel is themed in a very modern and futuristic style - but we loved it for this reason. The staff in the hotel were brilliant. The reception staff were very well informed about the city and every time we assked for help they gave us the perfect advise (ie. how to get to places, where to eat at night, etc) The roof top bar / pool area is very nice and gives FANTASTIC views over the port / city depending which way you look. I would say the pool is not for swimming though - it is tiny and I would be disappointed if I had booked the hotel in the summer to use the pool as it really is small. There is a bar in the lobby of the hotel. It is a very cool and modern style and we had drinks here. The 'barman / waiter' came to your table for your order and then served the drinks to you. He was very friendly! There is a good cocktail menu in this bar!!! We didnt use the restaurant as we like to eat out when away - but it looked nice and the menu was good. The city itself was outstanding. I booked the holiday as a surprise for my boyfriends 30th so that we could watch Barcelona play at Nou Camp. We did all the tourist stuff - sight seeing etc and found that the Big Red Bus Tour was great value for money and an easy way to get around the city. We also purchased T10 tickets for the underground/tram network and these were brilliant - you use one 'blip' per person for a journey no matter where you go or how many trains (so for example, to get to Nou Camp you need to get a tram from the hotel to the city centre and then change to the underground - but you only need to use one 'blip' as you dont exit the station). I would recommend the hotel for couples and I loved the view we had from our room!!! Oh - it did rain throughout saturday night but the rain did not disturb us in room 424..

Reviews.Title: “Business in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Bish555
Reviews.Content: Very modern and cubic! Well run and the staff were very nice/helpful. It was easy ot find, tram and tube outside. I wasn't actually in the hotel that much as I was on business. The breakfast was excellent. It was a perfect business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mulder1966
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference at the Convention Center in Barcelona. The hotel is very cool, with a very trendy design. The room was very clean and comfortable, with design furniture with a fantastic view on the Agbar tower. The staff at the reception was very kind and very helpful with my requests. I really reccomend this hotel on a business trip especially if you attend a conference at the Centro de Convenciones Internacional de Barcelona (CCIB) which is at few tram stops from the hotel (15min).

Reviews.Title: “Wifi not great, stretch to be 4 STAR”
Reviews.Author: franklyVirginia
Reviews.Content: Got this place on priceline but only 11% off. The location rocks. But the wifi stinks. I hope management reads this. Your Kobi wifi login sytem is ANNOYING! Constantly having to relogin each device a few times a day with a cyptic username and password. Get rid of it. also avoid room 115. Very noisey right over the street.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: PEHowland
Reviews.Content: Modern and tastefully decorated. Great breakfast. Close to Glories metro station, which is 10 mins for Catalunya - in the heart of Barcelona. 2km from the sea front. Close to Glories shopping centre Nd a number of bars and restaurants. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in suite, bit of confusion”
Reviews.Author: girlfromlondon
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend in the Silken Diagonal. It's not exactly in the tourist centre of Barcelona but is a very quick metro ride, and the metro is 2 min away. The hotel is of modern design, not exactly cozy but smart. I'm sure the roof terrace would be nice in the summer and when it's not raining. When we arrived there was some confusion as we had booked with a special offer but the message hadn't got through. First we had a room without a nice view which wasn't what we booked so we then moved to one on the other side. Both these rooms were ok but a bit small and the furniture was a bit shabby. Then we got a phone call from reception and they moved us to a suite up on the 9th floor, which I guess was the one we actually booked (or perhaps an upgrade, not sure). Anyway, it was lovely - a corner room with great views and both a bath and shower. I would recommend booking one of these. The rest of the stay was great, just the place to retreat from the rain! There is free wifi with a code from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish hotel, great location & access to city”
Reviews.Author: lcollens
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner for a weekend in Barcelona. The modern hotel has many stylish touches with lots of brass, shiny floors and white furniture in the lobby. LOCATION: Hotel is well placed opposite a shopping area with restaurants and shops like Zara, Massimo Dutti etc, Starbucks etc. It is also next to a tram line and metro station (useful for getting around town). There are a lot of bars/restaurants heading towards a large roundabout which is packed on the weekend. The hotel near to several sights including the Sagrada Familia and the Torre which lights up at night. You can see the Sagrada Familia from the roof terrace. ROOM: We had a standard room which was very comfortable with a floor to ceiling window on one side of the room looking out into the shopping area. Bathroom was interesting - make sure you are sharing with someone you are comfortable with as there is an uninterrupted view of the showers through a large glass pane. There are plugs in the bathroom- handy! The room coms with TV (BBC News is the only English speaking channel) and a well stocked mini bar. You also get nice sweets next to the bed! BAR/RESTAURANT: We did not eat in the hotel as to be honest the prices looked a little exorbitant and Barcelona has so many great places to eat there is no point is eating there simply because of the convenience. The bar is at hotel entrance where we spent a lot of time with a short cocktail menu. At peak times, they could do with more than one bartender. While the roof terrace was closed when we were there, it is well worth going to the top floor to get a look at the view, especially at night. WOULD I STAY HERE AGAIN? Definitely. We found a special rate online and recommend shopping around to see if you can get one too. With so many great quality hotels in Barcelona, this one stands out due to its location and style.

Reviews.Title: “Decorative and great view”
Reviews.Author: Adamlead2011
Reviews.Content: Unusually styled hotel, which is what made me book this in the first place. Decor sums it up on entry. Very dark and the roof looks fantastic. Staff smart, speak good English and were extremely helpful with the questions I asked them. Great location to stay if you are staying as a couple. Room is clean, Modern and spacious and the view of the Sagrada is fantastic. Perfectly placed opposite an open air shopping centre with a Carrefour placed bang in the middle, so we bought our Breakfast and Lunch from there and kept it in the fridge, few restaurant/bar type places here too for a swift Cerveza. Within 2 minute walking distance to Tram/Metro and Bus stop. Easy job on the train from the Airport. Get the train straight to El Clot and it's one stop on the Metro to Glories. The guy below does have a point on the banging though. It rained on our last night and we heard a banging noise of some sort. Luckily one of my ears was blocked, so I turned over. Great hotel though and were thoroughly pleased we got our value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: amarano65
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine unless it happens to rain. Water drips from the roof onto decorative metal plates outside your window, making it sound like you have a drummer outside your window. I ask the desk to move my room and they stated that every room had the same problem. Hotel managements response was to give out free ear plugs. Both times I went to the front desk to complain, other guests were also at the desk complaining. I could not fall asleep in this hotel while it was raining, and actually checked out of the hotel and into another one at 4 AM, just to ensure I did not need to spend another night in this hotel. Aslo, when I checked in, there were dirty towel in the bathroom, bottles in the cash bar that had been opened, emptied and the caps put back on the bottle, and the maids left dirty cleaning clothes on the desk. Avoid, especially if you want to get a good night sleep, unless you can guarantee it will not rain during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price”
Reviews.Author: CL81
Reviews.Content: Modern, stylish, clean hotel. Really nice decor throughout. Rooms lovely, comfortable, clean and fashionable. Lots of light and great black out blinds. Good size bathrooms but glad this trip was with my husband and not a friend as the bathroom (excluding toilet) was all glass! View was a waste land but was nice and quiet. Corridors reminded me of the playboy as oddly dark with neon lights! Excellent standard for the price we paid. Large shopping centre very close and tourist attractions accessible by metro or bus but no where near as close as I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel next door to Agbar tower”
Reviews.Author: Kuu_travel
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a fashionable look and nice big rooms including integrated glass wall bathroom. I am not sure it will age well, but right now it has a moderm minimalistic decor that is nice and confortable. Using the lifts was a bit triky as you have to select the floor before entering. Location is not very central but it is close to the beach and las Glorias shoping center as well as in the middle of the new business district of the city so quite convenient for business travels.

Reviews.Title: “Modern European Architecture”
Reviews.Author: CDNBears
Reviews.Content: This is a contemporary award winning Arcitectural masterpiece. Based on the Bahhaus tradition, the hotel also reflects a theme of an underwater experience. A subtle blue glow is found throughout the hotel. Even the bar stools are designed like the open mouth of a shark. The site is a leisurly walk to the Sagrata Familia. A classic work of secular architecture designed by Gaudi which is still under construction. The hotel is also walking distance to the local shopping mall, but don;t look for the aprking lot full of cars. Barcelonians do not use them much. Everything is pedestrian or bicycle oriented here. If you want to get to any of the urban sites like the Ramblas or the Promenade, just hop on the subway at the intersection of the roundabout outside.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Jen M
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about location before I stayed here but the location was fantastic- a 10 minute walk to the beach, the metro station is a 3 minute walk from the hotel so the whole of Barcelona is easily accessible. I'd seen reviews mentioning the glass wall in the bathroom so wouldnt recommend staying here without someone you're really comfortable with- not somewhere to stay with friends! Staff were really lovely and we got a room straight away even though we were a few hours early for check in because of our flight times. One bit of advice is that room cleaning starts early so make sure you use your do not disturb sign if you don't want to be bothered but overall the room and hotel was lovely and we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the view, and the hotel is great too”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: You'll never get lost staying at this hotel as it is located directly next to the Akbar Tower, a new trademark and iconic image of Barcelona. The view as you walk or drive up to the hotel at night is just eye-popping, and it always helps you find your way home. We got an amazing deal on the hotel as well, likely because it is really not centrally located next to the tourist sites. That said, the metro is right next door and very easy to use. And, that's why the hotel, though sparkling and new, isn't that expensive. Extra points for the cool rooftop sunning area with the plunge pool and bar. Very fun.

Reviews.Title: “well worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: appyhammer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, and found this hotel to be clean, the rooms to be well equiped, apart from no kettle. It cost approx 30 euro from hotel to airport. The quirks of this modern hotel is that the lifts take some getting used to, and if you dont like being naked in front of your partner the bathroom would not appeal to you as it has glass walls. Also it is a bit confusing when you are trying to be quiet going for a midnight pee in the dark and banging into the glass!! Close to good transport links and a mall across the road to avoid paying for hotel priced breakfasts. Barcelona itself was a joy to visit with lots of things to do/see but for me was a visit to the footie ground was the highligght simply stunning. I would go back and use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the glass bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: SallyOday
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, not far from Glories metro station and close to shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is modern looking and clean. One very odd feature is a glass bathroom. There is a mesh seperating screen in the room but it really does not do anything to help the fact that you can be seen in the bathroom/shower by whoever you are sharing a room with. Suitable for single travellers or a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced but a few features I found unusual”
Reviews.Author: bazellis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, out of the bustle of the city centre but only 10/15 minutes away if travelling from Glories metro stop (if you're staying for a few days buy a 10 trip metro ticket as these represent the best value for money). There is a shopping centre, with various fast food eateries/restaurants/tapas bars and a supermarket, just across the Avenue Diagonal. Taxi from airport is around 35 Euros (this includes a hefty 25% surcharge for travelling in a party of more than one) The reception and floor corridors are very dimly lit which is a bit disconcerting at first, especially at night. The lift is unique in that you enter your floor destination on a keypad in the lobby. The lift then assigns you a choice of lift (either A, B or C). Make sure you enter the correct lift, as you cannot change your floor choice once in the lift. The room (room 420) was reasonably sized. The bed was large but firm and the pillows were not to my taste (not substantial enough) and I had to request additional ones. When it comes to the bathroom, this is where things get a little weird. The front part of the bath/shower are enclosed in a glass partition which is completely visible from the main room, whilst the side are encased by a shaded fabric sort of cover which only partially resticts the view. The rooms are therefore not really suitable for couples who are not comfortable seeing each other naked! The power to the rooms are controlled by placing your room card in a card slot, and are fully air conditioned (during hot weather I recommend you place any spare loyalty type card you may have in the slot during the day so your room is kept cool). The mini bar was expensive (as you'd expect), but I prefer to buy my own provisions and keep these in the fridge instead (the cleaning staff don't seem to mind!). The rooms are advertised as sound proofed, but this is definitely not the case. There is a building site next door and the sound of the piledriver can wake you up around 8am, so not recommended for those wanting to sleep in late in the morning. In addition to this the windows in the rooms have automated sliding blinds which are quite noisy and these can be heard from other rooms. The hotel also has a small rooftop terrace with pool, although the pool only measures 7ft/4ft and the number of beds/chairs is rather limited. I paid around 90 Euros a night which I think is about right for this hotel, certainly no more.

Reviews.Title: “Praetorian Marketing trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: peterrudge
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel it had amazing conference facilities right near the city centre of barcelona recommended for any business trips. Peter Rudge - Praetorian Marketing Birmingham

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, stylish, colorful; fun and annoying at the same time”
Reviews.Author: JetBoys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stylish and colorful. It is a quirky, unusual hotel with distinct positives and negatives. I think some guests will really like it while others will find it quite annoying. The rooftop pool is a cool-looking triangle, but only seven meters at longest point and quite shallow. More a communal urinal for the rooftop bar than an actual swimming pool. The walls and roof are open to the Barcelona breezes and enjoyable views. The elevators are clean inside with no buttons or controls. Instead of a call button for up or down outside the elevators, there is a keypad on which guests enter their destination floor. The display shows the selected floor, then the assigned elevator (designated "A", "B", and "C"). It's important to watch for the elevator identifier, because it is only displayed briefly, and if you get into the wrong one, you'll end up elsewhere. Once inside there is no opportunity to choose a floor or change your mind. My room at least was quite small, and (typical for Europe), the supposed king-size bed was two beds next to each other, with separate mattresses, sheets, etc. I was disappointed in the lack of drawer space (only two shallow ones) but there are also a few shelves. My room had windows on two sides (one on Avenida Diagona) which opened for fresh air. There were two shades, one for darkness, and a sheer one for privacy, both electrically raised and lowered by bed-side controls. Housekeeping supplies tiny boxes of folded-up Kleenex with only five tissues per box. I found this wasteful (lots of extra packaging) and annoying. The bathroom has all-glass walls to the room. This allows in more light, and provides an open, interesting look. However, it might not be good for friends or couples staying in one room (although the toilet is in its own room with a non-glass door). The rainshower in the tub is nice, but lack of a divider (common for Europe) means the floor gets flooded with every shower, no matter how brief. There are no washcloths. I dislike hotels that cheap out like this. If I'd had a knife I'd have hacked down a hand towel. There are ample warnings about not leaving valuables in the room or in drawers, being sure the safe and room doors are closed properly, etc. This hotel has the worst Internet access I experienced in four continents. Even the premium, "business-grade" couldn't keep a VPN or ssh connection up, and Skype was unusable. The room layout is evil: placement of furniture relative to bed forces one to walk in a narrow channel around the corner of the bed. The mattress sits set back on a wood frame, so the eye sees the white sheet-clad mattress but not the dark edge of the platform, so the shin hits the corner of the frame. If I bang my shin once, I figure it's my fault for being clumsy, but when it happens repeatedly, I blame the system. To their credit, the breakfast buffet was very nice, and included both smoked salmon and plain yoghurt (two things I always want) as well as other meats and cheeses, a large number of pork products, eggs, and a nice selection of fresh fruit, which included sliced and skinned kiwifruit (a definite plus in my book). I found the front desk staff very friendly and helpful, as were the housekeepers and restaurant workers. There is a assistant in the lobby instructing guests on how to operate the elevators. The hotel has a main door on Avenida Diagona with steps. There are also two side doors, one of which has a ramp, but this is not obvious, so guests are always struggling to get their luggage up and down the steps.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: keri123
Reviews.Content: lovely views over city of barecelona,nice pool on top of hotel.the rooms were so modern and clean.little shopping centre just across the road,where you could get fresh bread and doughnuts for breakfast.the breakfast at the hotel was very good if you wanted to treat yourself and hav e a glass or two of carva.great hotel would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: u01mph
Reviews.Content: Positives: Good location. 2 minutes walk from Glories metro stop which means you can get from the hotel to the heart of the city in about 15 minutes. Also has a shopping mall and supermarket directly opposite the entrance so it's simple to pick up anything you need during your stay. Staff are helpfull and corteous without bending over backwards for you. Hotel is clean and modern and housekeeping is high quality. Comfortable beds and great showers, great after a day spent trecking around the city. Negatives: Not too many. I would say the price is around 30 more than they should be charging for this type of hotel but this seems to be common in Barcelona. If you're in a double/twin room make sure it's with someone you don't mind seeing you naked because the bathroom/shower walls are glass! Thankfully the toilet is behind a door. Tip: There's a doorman in the lobby called Dima. Speak to him about a transfer back to the airport when you're checking out. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Funky is fine but must be functional too!”
Reviews.Author: HWalais
Reviews.Content: This is one of the more expensive hotels I've stayed in at 230 euro per night (special conference rate too mind you!) Not suitable as a business hotel, but the problems are entirely due to the management decisions of the hotel, as you can see by the issues I list. The staff were great, very efficient and helpful. Especially the night desk attendant who checked us in at half past midnight on 21st September and dealt with a crowd and busy telephone with patience and charm. (1) No iron/ ironing board in room. Rang to ask for an iron, room service brought a travel iron with a UK plug (?) fortunately we have a universal adapter but the iron did not work. Rang again and room service brought another with a european plug, but it was covered with scorch marks and burnt clothes residue. Trying to iron a short for a business meeting the next day on a table (not ironing board possible apparently) with a crap iron when arriving after midnight is not my idea of fun. (2) bathroom arrangement - terrible!!. Glass walls around the bathroom area mean you are 'on display' when having a shower. Offputting to say the least. Also impossible not to flood the bathroom floor, as there is such a short glass screen around the bath and the bath surround does not allow draining back to the bath. I dread to think of the water damage that this must cause in the hotel. Lovely fixtures and fittings but implemented in an impractical stupid way. (3) room not clean - sticky rings on the table and floor not vacuumed around the desk area. (4) dark fake oak veneer Ikea-like furniture seem trendy, but it looks crap when chipped and scratched (as it was in our room, 504). View is of a building site with accompanying noise next door. (4) performance of the wireless-only (no ethernet connection) internet service was bad. Unreliable - fell out every 10 minutes IF you could even get a connection. If you intend to do work while staying here rather than being a tourist I recommend another hotel because you simply won't be able to do any.

Reviews.Title: “Location is very good”
Reviews.Author: Evi_K64
Reviews.Content: Location is very good for shopping and transportation.This hotel would also be perfect for a business trip. Metro two minutes walk away! The shower glass that served as curtain was too shallow that water spilled out to the bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel located in Barcelona 22@ area”
Reviews.Author: madridvoyageur
Reviews.Content: A frequent business traveller to Barcelona 22@ area, I spent 1 night in this hotel located on Diagonal, next to Glories and the shopping center (15 mins from city center by metro or tramway). My room was clean, modern,a typical modern design hotel. Bathroom with glass walls (which I expect can be inconvenient for some people). The shower wasn't working very well. Nice roof-top swimming pool and bar area (actually more appropriate for having drinks than for swimming). Good breakfast and good restaurant, with an excellent-value lunch menu. In my opinion, maybe not the best option in the area, but still a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, definitely staying here again”
Reviews.Author: jimbo1683
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights, it's a brilliant hotel. Only a couple of minutes from a metro and tram stop, the shopping centre opposite has a square with small restaurants which are all really nice and expecially good for cheap breakfasts. The rooftop deck, bar and pool are great, drinks are pretty reasonable and it's nice to sit up there in the evening. Rooms are fab, we had a 'standard' room on the 4th floor but had a great view, the glass bathroom and electric blinds make the room that bit different from a normal 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel close to metro”
Reviews.Author: Ineke_Belgium
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the busy city centre but the metro is a 3 minute walk away and will bring you direclty to the centre of Barcelona. If you want to shop there is a shopping mall across the street with also some dining facilities. From the rooftop terrace you have a nice view over the city. The swimming pool is on the small side, not good for doing laps. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and some have a nice view of the Agbor tower, Sagrada familia and the rest of the city. The only thing missing in the room is a coffee machine. The breakfast buffet has plenty of choice and also a small diet corner. Downside is that it is every day the same. If you want you can also dine at the rooftop bar. If you don't want to stay close to the centre but not in the hustle and bustle of it then this is a very good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Dana23
Reviews.Content: Visited Barcelona with best friends and had a blast. As it was our first time in Barcelona we were pleasantly surprised by this ultra-modern European hotel. It took us awhile to figure how to turn on the lights (room key!) but then realized that America could benefit from these energy conscious touches! The bed was a bit low for my taste but large and comfortable. The room decor was also minimalist which we also assumed to be culturally unique, but we enjoyed our view from a top floor. There is a bit of a privacy issue (perfect for couples ) when using the bathroom as the walls are complete glass however thankfully the toilet area was concealed. Also in a very convenient location- right across the street is a large shopping area where we found ourselves in often. Only wished we could stay in Barcelona longer than the two days we had scheduled- it is a beautiful city and we loved everything- especially the gelato!! Will definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BetoChristo
Reviews.Content: The stay at Silken Daigonal was great. This is my second time visiting Barcelona and I found a cool place out of the bustle Ramblas. It's a cutting edge 4 stars hotel with very nice linen, nice amenities and free internet access in the room. Very cool interior design, not only in the bedroom, but all over. Their rooftop has a small pool but a nice bar to have a drink and some "Tapas"during the evening. The hotel is located just beside the Agbar Tower, there is a shopping mall accross the street and a subway station 5 minutes walking. You still have the tram and a taxi stop in the street beside. So it's very easy to reach the Ramblas, or Paseo de Gracia, or Example. Just to give an idea, a cab from Example to the hotel costs around 10 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Elke L
Reviews.Content: Adviced by our travel agency as a nice, trendy hotel a friend and I booked without a single doubt. Luckily we booked two rooms, because if you are just friends, it is almost impossible to have a bath or shower with any privacy. If one is sitting in a chair or on the bed, she can see the other taking a shower in the bathroom. Arrived on Sunday and tried to use the safe. Asked the reception for a solution. Had to remember them on Tuesday again. They sent the maintenance man who showed me a trick: had to pull at the login screen to be able to open the safe. Taking a bath - which is really an experience- the electricity went down - because the plug broke. Calles my friend to check if electricity at her room was working. Tried to show her how I should open my safe and failed. Luckily this time the maintenance man came soon - repaired the plug and told me he couldn't fix the safe. I should get another one sone. Now - one week later - still no safe. Btw, safe is large enough for a netbook, not laptop. Using my friend's safe now. Taking a shower is awful! All the water runs on the bathroom floor. Positive: every day clean towels, sheets, bath foam, shampoo,.... A pity that kids are diving in the 4*2 m pool, which isn't designed to be used for that. Breakfast is ok, but the only extra is the unlimited cava and wine. Every day the same things. Elevators are nice and comfortable, but make noice, which disturbs when trying to get to sleep. Hotel staff is really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Boxette
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a very high level of service at this hotel. Our room was on the 4th floor and was very clean with plenty of space. The shower was excellent with plenty of hot water and our room was cleaned every day. Even though it is out of town, this hotel is next door to the metro so we could leave our hotel and be in Las Ramblas in no more than 15 mins. The tram line is just across the street so we went to the beach on the tram and it was also very convenient. And just directly across the street, we could take the city tour bus. So this is a really good location as it is not so noisy. Overall, I liked this hotel and I really liked the breakfasts with a wonderful selection of food available. What I liked least was that the dividing walls between the rooms appear to be quite thin, but our room was quiet so maybe we had quiet neighbours but this would not deter me from recommending it. there is a large shopping centre across the street also with a wonderful supermarket for all your food requirements.

Reviews.Title: “A Different Aspect of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: moneyconvertor
Reviews.Content: Taxi fare from the airport was 27 Euros. We found this modern hotel a welcome change from the hotels we usually stay in around Las Ramblas. Check in was swift and very friendly. We speak a little Spanish and like to try it out when in Spain.. The reception staff were very kind and humoured us, although they spoke excellent English. We were given a street map. Our bags were taken to our room on the 6th floor and the room was a corner room with 2 huge glass windows, it definately had the wow factor and a fantastic view across to the Sagrada Familia from one window. Electic blinds blacked out all light when closed and although situated on the busy Diaganol road, we weren't troubled by noise. Opposite the hotel is a large shopping centre with a Carrefour supermarket and outdoor cafes etc, however, we set off to explore and found many very nice Spanish restaurants within easy walking distance. If you turn right outside the hotel and walk along then turn into the Rambla del Poblenau, there are lots of outdoor street restaurants. Carry on and you reach the the beach with sunbeds and beach bars. Turning left will take you to the Sagrada Familia. There is the Glories metro station nearby, if you want to go further afield and the hop on, hop off tourist busses. In our room we had a large, comfortable bed, flat screen TV, mini bar and safe deposit box. i did have issues with the bathroom however. The door is glass and I kept walking into it and stubbing my toes. I also managed to flood the bathroom floor! There is a bath tub with a large shower head above and another shower head that can be removed and hand held. I wanted to have a bath as we had been walking all day and my poor feet needed a soak. While trying to fathom out how the taps worked, well anyway, enough said. At least there were enough towels to mop the floor. Would we stay here again. Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with all comfort”
Reviews.Author: Nemcali
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. i stayed only one night but I'll definitively be back there. The room is modern and stylish with the necessary comforts. The staff at reception is very helpful in booking taxis, restaurants, etc. Overall it's been a very positive experience. Very recommended. Price is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular and stylish .. won't break the bank”
Reviews.Author: OzNoproblem
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with great style and wondeful service.It's right next to the spectacular Torre Agbar and in view of Segrada .. so drinks and food on the rooftop bar as the sun goes down are quite an experience. Breakfast buffet is perhaps the best I have encountered - the range of fine foods is extensive. It's 3 or 4 stops from the Ramblas and has great access to teh Metro. Good shopping across the road with access to ATM. And the city tourist bus also stops outside the hotel. The young woman runnning the business was extremely helpful when I needed some help with documents. What more can I say? The hotel was a perfect home for 4 days in the wonderful city..

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, 3 stops on the Metro from City Centre”
Reviews.Author: JocastaTravels
Reviews.Content: The Silken Diagonal is a modern hotel with trendy décor located next to the Torres Agbar landmark, so easy to find once you become acquainted with the Metro. The hotel is located closest the Glories Metro Station which is on the Red Line and only three stops from the city centre. It’s also one stop from Clot Metro Station which connects to the main railway line for access to the airport. I’d recommend buying a 2, 3 or 4 day ticket for the Metro as it’s the cheapest way to get around. The red hop on hop off tour bus also stops directly opposite the hotel so it’s worth buying a two day ticket (30 Euros) as there are two routes which go east and west round the city and it’s a great way to see the sites. There are no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms, but there is a small fridge in the mini bar which we used for own purchases of water, wine, yoghurts, etc., which we bought in the supermarket opposite as the hotel breakfasts were expensive. We drank coffee in Starbucks in the shopping centre opposite rather than sit in the hotel so we could sit outside in the sun. The bathrooms are not very private so I wouldn’t go here with someone I didn’t know very well. They are separated from the bedroom by a glass wall covered with fabric screen that is semi-see through. One person would have to leave the room if they wanted to shower privately. The bathroom looks nice but it’s not very practical as the floor was always wet; however, the towels were changed daily. The rooms are nice and dark but the electric shutters and blinds are quite noisy and I could hear the lift whistling all night, but my friend slept through it and never heard a thing. The ‘pool’ on the roof is a nice area to sit although it’s not actually a pool – you can get in to get wet and cool off if you are hot but you couldn’t swim in it. It also only seemed to get the sun in the morning as the Torres Agbar meant it was in the shade later. The views are great though and if you go to the back of the pool area you can see the Segrada Familia from a good vantage point. I didn’t see any pool parties in the week we stayed there, in fact there was hardly anyone sitting there at night, we took our own wine up there one night as the roof-top bar was closed. The beach is within walking distance (30 mins) or you can take the Metro. Be warned that the Metro closes at midnight during the week so we ended up walking home on the first night as we couldn’t fathom the route of the night buses and it was a good hour and a half walk in dress sandals! No problems with the reception staff understanding English and we were able to leave our cases as we had a late flight. Overall I’d say this hotel is suited to young people or business people travelling alone. Perfectly acceptable accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel catering for people who don't sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: GEORDIEJUNE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights before our cruise with Celebrity! On Arrival we were very impressed with foyer. The hotel was buzzing with young men and realised there must be an event being held... Rooftop party...music blared for most if the weekend and the noise was disgusting through the night. Doors were being slammed and our rude ignorant neighbours held their own private party all night. Walls are paper thin so we could hear all the conversations and also the mechanics of electric blinds! The bed was very firm and the room was ok. Plenty toiletries supplied. The breakfast was excellent and we also had an evening meal which was lovely. We wanted to go in the swimming pool but could not get near it for young people drinking! On leaving the hotel for the port our pick up with A2B transfers did not turn up. However the staff on reception were useless in helping us as their English was hopeless!! We did flag a taxi down on the main road. Location is ok if you don't mind using the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “very good choise”
Reviews.Author: rofese
Reviews.Content: Clean ( but not spotless), located in beautiful and quiet area, easy transport, excellent breakfast, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hansiman
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 2 nights at Silken Diagonal. Nice hotel with good location. Easy acces to public transport (tram just across the street). Large shopping mall also across the street. Rooms were standard size (probably 'small' for Americans), but modern and clean. Free (but slow) WiFi for browsing and e-mails. Nice rooftop terrace (10th floor) with a tiny pool and bar. Great location to hang out after work and enjoy the views of the town. Like someone already posted; corridors are dark with blue lighting, which is somewhat odd. Probably the architect watched to many StarTrek movies or so. Overall, it was a good hotel; you get what you'd expect from such a hotel and I would definately stay there again when visiting Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not let them stick you in Room 720”
Reviews.Author: AudioSmear
Reviews.Content: We have been to Barcelona twice and stayed in the good and bad parts of it. I had very high hopes for this hotel, but they were quashed by some functional issues that were not resolved to our satisfaction. The only reason I am giving this hotel 2 stars is because the breakfast is phenomenal. When Americans travel to spain, they must realize that breakfast and lunch are more emphasized than dinner, as Spaniards typically only eat tapas for dinner. The purpose of our trip was to go to for Sonar music festival parties (not the festival itself) and see the city, and this hotel has legendary rooftop parties. Our expectation was that there would be a lot of people partying in the hotel knowing the situation, so that is not what our dissatisfaction is about. The main thing is that I think they saw we were from Detroit and so they assumed we had no standards. We paid 165 euros (about $200/night) to sleep in a TINY (the "comfort" room, ironically enough) room, have breakfast, and go the the rooftop parties. Here's a list of everything that sucked about the hotel: 1. Our room did NOT have WIFI as advertised. No signal - zilch, zero, none. When my fiance brought this to the attention of the front desk, they said they knew our room didn't have it, but they couldn't move us because they were booked. Instead they gave us a pass for full internet access instead of web browsing, but as anyone on Trip Advisor knows, that doesn't matter if you can't get a freaking signal. They wouldn't even give us an ethernet cable to jack into the wall. I was really quite annoyed to learn that they knew about this problem in advance and didn't fix it in between the time we booked and arrived, which was about two months. It was very important for me to have net access because it was the only way for me to get in touch with my friends looking after our dogs, and yeah, I could have gone to the lobby... if I could have caught an elevator. More on that later. After this problem, we didn't report anything else, as all we expected is more sorry excuses as to why it "was not possible" to fix them. 1. The air conditioning didn't work, so we had to open the window = no rest for the weary, due to the loudness and the window needing to be opened constantly in order to avoid pruning. 2. The handle in the bathroom was all janky jankerson. Both my fiance and my friend (staying in another room) both got stuck in the bathroom and we had to let them our from the outside. 3. The furniture is very low quality ikea crap. Sure, it looks nice... if you can get past the nicks, dings, and spills, I guess the "design" is fair, but NOT FUNCTIONAL, and certainly not spectacular as the propaganda on their website would have you believe. As any good architect knows, the design must both function and be aesthetically pleasing to fall into the category of spectacular. 4. This room beat the living daylights our of us. Every time we turned around in the tiny room we either got a Tanya Harding to the shins from the bed corners or a sharp edge of a door handle digging into the back of our arms or some other like injury. 5 . When they changed our white bed linens, there was a big dirt stain on the top layer. 6. They never left us a price list for the mini-bar where it was supposed to be, even after they cleaned the room. 7. It was IMPOSSIBLE to catch the elevator, so there was a lot of stairwell climbing. Instead of reserving 1 elevator for people just going to the party, and the other 2 for people staying at the hotel, they co-mingled all 3 elevators. 8. The security was very rude. Also, even though we were paying out the behind to stay at the hotel, they would not let us bring drinks from the hotel onto the roof (even though you can do that at pretty much any hotel if the drinks are in a plastic cup), so drinks were 10 euro, the crappy quality beer was 5 euro - that even goes for people who got their drinks from the mini bar. I could see not letting people who weren't staying there not bring stuff in, but your own guests? seriously? terrible, terrible service. 9. Whenever we had a question about something at the front desk, they responded with an arrogant stank-eye instead of working with you to resolve the situation. 10. There is no ATM/ cash machine in the hotel - you have to go on a full out jungle excursion to the mall across the street if you want money. It literally wasted 2 hours of our vacation trying to find the darn thing. If most jet-setters are anything like us, the last place you want to go on vacation is to a flipping mall. 11. They didn't bother to clean the swimming pool on the roof, where the parties were, while the parties were going on. There was a bunch of litter and dirt accumulating. I was scared to take a dip, even though somedays it was pretty ungodly in terms of heat... and our a/c was broken. I know this is not what many people would want to accept as the truth, and I didn't listen to previous trip advisor reviews either because it looked so nice and was next to Torre Agbar, etc, but retrospectively I wish I had. The only thing mildly convenient was being able to ring 2 or 3 sets of friends staying in adjacent rooms... and the breakfast was fresh and delightful, but truthfully, the breakfast is fresh and delightful at almost any non-tourist restaurant in Barca! Do yourself a favor... don't waste your trip here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel....but.....”
Reviews.Author: naz26
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. Everything was going fine and well until our last night, when it stormed and rained the whole night. At another hotel, not an issue. Here, you will not sleep that night. Outside the hotel above each floor's windows are long, hollow aluminum shades of some kind. When rain hits these the sound is so loud throughout the whole room nothing can drown it out. Not the AC or the TV, nothing. We had a flight to Majorca to catch early the next morning and because it happened to rain all night, we got no sleep. It may sound like I'm nitpicking, but believe me if you happen to stay in the fall or spring when it may rain all night, you'll experience the same thing that we did. It is for this reason alone I would never recommend this hotel, and it is a shame because it was just an awful design flaw that ruined an otherwise great experience. I'm sure if you go during a non-rainy season, and you appreciate modern design, you would like this hotel. It is rather spartan however (did not even have an iron board in the room) and the shower situation was annoying (only half covered with no curtain or door to close, so water gets all over the bathroom floor when showering). Clean and decently priced though, and the rooftop was great (not really a swimming pool up there though, more like a wade pool).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Maherz
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic modern hotel. Glories metro station (Line 1) is just around the corner, about 5 min walk. In front of the hotel a big Mall with a food court and Carrefour hyper market. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was disgusting and we certainly wont be back”
Reviews.Author: sbraid
Reviews.Content: Our room was a disgrace. More suited to a hostel than a 4 star hotel. The ceiling, walls, floor and furnishings were stained and dirty. The blinds were torn and stained. and the swimming pool was closed throughout our stay. The public areas of the hotel are of a good standard. We had a very bad experience and the manager will not respond to my e-mails. Avoid this hotel. There are lots of better and cheaper hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigPhilWarboys
Reviews.Content: All you could want from a stylish hotel. Not realy central but no trouble with taxis and breakfast is very good. great mini bar and toiletries and no issues with staff.But not cheap for a drink at the bar. Gin and tonic best part of £10.00 Swimming pool very small and roof topbar not open when we were there. so only 4 star rating from me.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: PHFerreira78
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Silken Diagonal Barcelona. Very modern and good hotel. Good sized room, confort, with a clean bathroom. The location is very good, beside Agbar tower, in front of the Glories Mall, close to the Glories metro station. Its a perfect hotel to enjoy the modern city of Barcelona (the view of the city from the hotel roof is an attraction itself). We will recommend this hotel to our friends and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: Finnanhaddie
Reviews.Content: Very good location: 3 minutes walk to the nearest Metro station at Glories, and a bus stop for the Barcelona Tour Bus right opposite the hotel. The Metro system also provides access to the railway network too. There are also tram and bus stops within a couple of minutes walk from the hotel front door. Finding the hotel underground car park caused a bit of problem the day we arrived. Parking is also 18 Euros per day. I left the car at the hotel and used the excellent public transport system instead. Clean room and well laid out. No coat hooks or pegs however, even in the bathroom, so outdoor jackets will have to be hung in the wardrobe. The front-line staff at the reception and the dining room could look happier, and try smiling at the guests occasionally. No information on breakfast or dining room times is verbally communicated by reception staff either, so be sure to read the information folder in the room. However, I would recommend a stay at the Silken Diagonal, and would certainly consider booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: wiffy0
Reviews.Content: We came back from our first amazing trip to Barcelona last night. We travelled there for sightseeing and the formula 1 GP. We found the Silken Diagonal through some google searches and booked which them direct which was a first for us as we normally book packages. The hotel is about 1 km (20 mins walk) to the Sagrada Familia and has good views of it as well. It is also only 2 min walk from metro station Glories and about 3 stops from the city centre. A bonus of this hotel is that across the road is a large shopping centre which also has a square with a few restaurants meaning you don't have to venture far if you don't want to. The room was lovely and airy. We absolutely loved the shower (massive shower head, great water pressure!). The electric blinds are quite cool and the floor to ceiling windows allow for some great views and light. The beds are large and very comfortable. The room was clean and well proportioned. I understand others comments regarding being able to see into the bathroom but as we are a couple it's not an issue. The toilet is closed off which is the main thing! The hotel also has a roof terrace with a plunge pool and loungers etc. The only drawback here is that the bar up there doesn't open during the day or early evening, meaning you have to go down 10 floors each time you want a drink from the bar at reception. The reason I gave service a 3 is because of the above about the terrace bar not being open and because I think the staff could have made more of an effort to make people feel welcome, such as smiling on occassion and cutting conversations short to serve people rather than finishing private conversations first. Also as we didn't really require any service, I don't have any other opinion on it. We had no problem leaving our bags at the hotel on the last day and they held in a secure storage room until you pick them up. The big attraction of this hotel is the location. I must state that there is some construction going on around the hotel and that the views from your room are not always going to be the best if you are on one of the lower floors. We weren't worried about this (we were on the 5th floor of a total 10 floors) as we didn't spent much time in the room as we were out all day and most of the evening, but others may be. The roof will always be the best place for views as you can see for miles. We didn't have any breakfast or meals at the hotel so I can comment on those other than to say breakfast is 18 EUR a person if you have not got it included in the price and this is for a simple continental breakfast so you may be better off popping to starbucks across the road for something to eat before you set off for the day. I could go on an on about what was great about Barcelona but this is a hotel review only I will leave it there. If you want a superbly located, modern, clean, light, quality hotel, I would recommend you give the Silken Diagonal a try.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, clean and stylish”
Reviews.Author: mrs_slink
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel with beautiful rooms. Breakfast is also good - take advantage of the free cava! The roof terrace is also great to check out the views and the hotel is near the metro station. My only caveat is that the rooms aren't greatly soundproofed, so ask for a room higher up to avoid street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend this hotel to a couple wanting a leisurely/sightseeing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Guitarsbard
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here over Easter 2011 for 3nights. A taxi from the airport was an expensive 35euros but on the way back we decided to get the underground metro (line T1) and then Aerobus. In total this cost us about 13euros so we'd definitely recommend this. The hotel is on the route of the sightseeing bus and so was a great location for us in that respect. We walked to port olympia and this took us 30mins but walking to the city center would have taken 45mins-an hour. However, the hotel is a 5min walk away from an 8min underground service straight to the center! Fabulous hotel, really stunning. The room was an extravagant simple with a full wall of glass with blackout shutters, great glass shower (not private so I would not recommend for friends - just couples), minibar, comfy plush double bed and a satellite LCD TV (only 2channels English). Great service, a really good stay and it made our experience of Barcelona an exceptional one - I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: ludodl
Reviews.Content: I came some days ago to that hotel with my family and made sure that my children could be accomodated with us in the room. I have a 5 yod daughter and a 3month old baby. That day we arrived the outside temperature was 28 deg C and we had the surprise to be upgraded into a suite at the hotel. Perfect room, until we discovered that the AC was not working. The temperature was more than 30 deg C after a while (the building is made of glass & steel only). After a few phone call to reception I was told the AC was not working, and was not going to work for my one night stay as we were a saturday and the technician would come only on a Monday. They admitted they knew the situation, they also knew we would come with a 3 month old baby. So not really professional from their part...they thought that having a suite would calm us... After some argument, we finally had one fan, the noisiest one I ever had which managed to cool down the room together with opening the windows. We had to keep the curtains open to let some air coming into the room, and of course kept the windows open. That hotel is situated in a busy street, next to a shopping center, so a bit noisy at night. We had a 20% discount at the end, which I asked otherwise they would have charge me the full amount. I met a colleague the day after who had exactly the same AC issue, in a single occupancy room. In his case a technician came and fixed it. There are still things I can't explain about that hotel... On the + side, the hotel is nicely located, next to the Tore Agbar, beautiful at night with varying colours. Beautiful view from the top floor with a small swimming pool. The hotel is situated as well next to a shopping center, and a metro station. Oh, one thing about the metro, don't listen to the receptionist who tells you that there are lifts at the metro station and that you can take your baby pram, there are nones. There are only stairs, many of them when you have to carry your pram... Taxi are cheap, cost around 8 euros to go to city centre. So I woul recommend that hotel if you know you're going to have AC, but the staff is not the best I had. Next door is the Novotel, cheaper, friendly & helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, but breakfast is far too pricey!”
Reviews.Author: ronancamp
Reviews.Content: This hotel overall is brilliant. Decor is fancy etc etc, Having read reviews about the staff being rude, I was expecting this but we were checked in no bother, I saw at times however, that rudeness come out. (this shouldn't be a factor on your stay though,as you will only have dealings with staff minimum twice-checking in/out. The Hotel is lovely, the rooms are comfortable and it is worth the stay. Now on the matter of breakfast, We got the hotel with breakfast on a deal, which made breakfast worth it. The breakfast is nice however, you can even get a glass of sparkling wine to have if you want, iberian ham etc. (which I hounded into every morning!) But over the length of the stay, €36 for 2 peson on Breakfast isn't worth it no way (plus there is a shopping centre with supermarket cross the road) Its only a short walk to glories metro stop (not the 10 minute walks that some reviewers have said) Personally it doesn't matter one bit where you stay as long as you get a Metro Card, you can fly round Barcelona no bother! 4 stops and then you are just off Las Ramblas I'd stay here again not a bother, Its a lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, modern and posh”
Reviews.Author: Kittenpatrol
Reviews.Content: It´s definetely an hotel that stands out for its design. The blue light in the bar gives a cool atmosphere right in the entrance hall. The big windows and the glassy wall in the bathroom, the corridors designed with diagonal lines, the round panels covering the ceeling of the restaurant ... lots of effort focused in details that impress those who appreciate decoration. Located close to Agbar tower, at night you can take very nice pictures from both buildings. The staff was not really warm, but OK. The windows are soundproof so no sleep problems. Close to the shopping mall, very handy ! Close to subway station. Tour bus hop on and off stops 5 meters from hotel, very good !

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: katrosey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and up until the last night we had no complaints. The staff didn't seem very friendly but we didn't expect what happened on the day we were due to leave. The night before we had experienced a group of young boys surrounding us at a metro underground station obviously seeing if we had anything worth taking. Luckily we noticed and moved away so the next day when we checked out of our hotel, the last thing we wanted was to carry all our valuables on us whilst having our small suitcases. We decided to leave our bags with the hotel in a key-coded room, they had a padlock on them but by the time we got back and retrieved our bags, both our mobile phones had been taken. We notified the receptionists straight away who dismissed what we were saying and told us it was a 4 star hotel!....... and are we sure we didn't put them some place else. We thought we were lucky to be vigilant on the metro and yet it happened whilst in our own hotel where we thought they were safely locked away.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: FedericoP4
Reviews.Content: Both hotel and restaurant best value for money in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: geocouple0106
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Silken Diagonal before getting on a Mediterranean Cruise leaving out of Barcelona.
