This hotel was one we could book directly through the cruise line, but considering they were charging 110euro per person we booked it online on our own. Considering we only spent 110euros total, I wasn't expecting much. This hotel is very modern and clean. The hotel staff were wonderful. Even after we checked out, they allowed us to store our bags for the day while we went sight seeing. The hotel was walking distance from the subway station, which made getting around town very easy. I would caution anyone to drag bags to/from the subway though. (While it is close to the station, next time I will get a cab with all the luggage we had) There wasn't any free internet (which is not unusual) Unfortunately the view from our room was of a large construction crane, but beyond that was a beautiful view of the city. It was a great place to cure the jet-lag with blackout shades and an extremely comfortable bed. I would love to stay here again and hope to one day!

Reviews.Title: “rather new hotel, not so convenient located”
Reviews.Author: Evgenia_87
Reviews.Content: Rather new hotel, supposed to be innovative designed - dim light in halls and corridors, panoramic windows in rooms, and transparent wall to bathroom (what is actually not so convenient).. the only point - everything's made a bit cheap and there's nothing to look in even panoramic windows. We had a view to construction place and next building. Rather faraway from the city, but tram station in 3 minutes to walk..

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: marialuana_77
Reviews.Content: great rooms , exceptional stuff , good location . loved it

Reviews.Title: “Showers not for sharing room with someone”
Reviews.Author: CLamberes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was far from the airport but you can get the blue bus (#1) at airport to center of town for 5 euros and then take taxi from center of town to hotel for additional 8 euros. Hotel is across the street from mall and grocery store so this is convenient. Tour bus picks you up in front of hotel and train station is near hotel. If you walk 2 blocks east and a few blocks south, you will find many nice restaurants and nice neighborhood. Hotel staff was very nice and helpful. WARNING: IF YOU ARE STAYING IN ROOM WITH SOMEONE AND YOU NEED PRIVACY, DON'T BOOK HERE. ROOM HAS SEE-THROUGH BATHROOM SO OTHER PERSON CAN COMEPLETELY SEE YOU TAKING A SHOWER- THERE IS NO PRIVACY. SOLUTION: WE PLACED MATTRESS UP AGAINST THE GLASS WALL PARTITION THAT SEPARATES BEDROOM AND BATHROOM/SHOWER FOR PRIVACY.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable… Deplorable quality and service”
Reviews.Author: Aegean27
Reviews.Content: We arrive at this hotel the 26 dec 2010. The hotel is located in the other side of the town. Fart from the airport. The location is very cold… at the end of a boulevard. And on the other side it overpass for the highway. The only thing is this Tower next to it. The metro station is about 10 min walking distance. But it located under this overpass and it not rely a safe area!!! About the reception… I have travel a lot… over America and Europe… And I have to say this It the worst reception I have experience at a Hotel… even as a student when we have stay in 2 stars hotels… Then about the Room… I have seen a lot of those new design stylish hotels they are the one we always looking for… But the Diagonal just give the impression of it… The room are to small… than the bathroom and toilet seem to be in the middle of the room. They are separate by a glass (find very …..Design) but they offer no alternative it always exposed . Than if you open the light in middle of the night you light up all the room. And the major and worst is the bed… it is not a mattress but a spring box, you feel the spring without any cushion… and they say King size it a Queen size. Our reservation was for 4 night we checkout the next morning, we found much superior at the same price. Brief there is many more hotel in Barcelona… for the comfort location and price.

Reviews.Title: “SEXY BOTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ManojR3
Reviews.Content: Hi Guys , This Hotel Rocks ... Amazing designer Hotel. Please donot forget to see all the catageroy of rooms there !!! Dont ever forget to see the suit room on the top floor. IT has all the facilities like opposite to it is shopping centers / Etc ... Always , Manoj.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable Stay .. I highly recommend this hotel ;))”
Reviews.Author: dalia_yousry
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i stayed there for 6 nights & i would love to stay there again. It is very clean hotel at a central location (4 stops by metro to placa catalunya) ,2 min walk to the metro and tram station & 15 min walk to cuitatella park & sagrada familia.There is a large shopping centre (Glories) right across the hotel .Great buffet breakfast, with lots of variety .The hotel also offers free WiFi .The staff speak English .Everything was just great except the small pool but who cares !! enjoy the nearby beach , only 15min walk ;) I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful contemporary hotel!”
Reviews.Author: craiglegrice
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute weekend away in Barcelona to celebrate my other half's birthday. Not knowing the city, we chose by hotel rather than location - and were pleasantly surprised. A striking building, the hotel has a great cocktail bar, relaxing restaurant and - the best bit - a rooftop pool! Whilst not in the best location (we were a subway stop or two from where we'd ideally have stayed), there's still loads to do locally - shopping, bars, restaurants etc. 10/10 for the hotel... 8/10 for the location. The old "if we could just pick it up and move it" review...

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable and unhelpful.”
Reviews.Author: Crystal_SD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not as centrally located as desired. It also seemed to be a very nice hotel upon entering it. But once we got to the floor our room was on we smelled the sewer in the hallways, our room was a sauna, and the front desk could not get the AC to work or put us into a new room. We called down multiple times only to be told no technician was on sight and to turn it off and then back on and give it 20 minutes. We gave it 8 hours and it still wasn't cooler! The rooftop pool is also smaller than you assume from the images provided. But otherwise it is an awesome place to layout, see the city, and see the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “cool design, good location”
Reviews.Author: milesandme
Reviews.Content: Very well designed modern hotel that provides for a relaxed comfortable stay. Rooms are spacios (stay already twice here) and very well lit. Windows allow a perfect view - one side onto the Torre Agbar and other side towrds the see - you can see the towers of hotel arts and Mapfre. Convenient location - opposite a shopping mall, another mall (Diagonal Mar) a few tram stops. You can easliy reach the Barceloneta beach by tram T4 - stop outside the hotel entrance (10 min ride). Top floor terrace with a pool and a bar has a relaxed atmosphere and amazing views (on nearby Torre Agbar, Sagrada Familia and as far as Tibidabo). Minibar prices overpriced, so bring in your own drinks from opposite supermarket. Next to hotel you will also find a seafood restaurant Gran Mariscada - reasonably priced and good quality and just a few steps from hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Convenient Location & a Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: teresita21
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here and found the location to be perfect for us. Room: Comfortably appointed though I found the bed too firm. Be aware that the shower/tub and bedroom are separated by a peek-a-boo see through glass wall which may not be for the shy. Bed linens were nice. Cable tv with 2-3 english channels (BBC News, CNN). Good AC and scenic floor to ceiling windows. Location: We enjoyed the hotel location and found it quite convenient. A two minute walk to the metro and another 2 minute ride to all the happenings of the Ramblas. La Sagrada Familia is within eyesite and maybe 20 minutes by foot. We also found it very helpful that there was a nice shopping mall accross the street. This was great for last minute or forgotten items and snacks. Resturants nearby are better quality and much better priced than more touristy areas. It was also pleasant to be able to interact with people who lived in the neighborhood. Other Useful: The rooftop bar is great on a warm Barcelona night. The view of the Torre Agbar cannot be beat. Service: We experienced great (albeit not warm) service from all staff. Most everyone spoke English well and was very tolerant (amused?) with my attempts at Spanish. I casually spoke to the front desk manager and learned that they do everything from answering phones and emails to concierge service - so bear this in mind.

Reviews.Title: “good location, rooms/design similar to novotel”
Reviews.Author: dietrichp
Reviews.Content: Just off Avenida Diagonal, 25 min by taxi from international airport, in easy reach of business district and just opposite large shopping mall. Rooms & food comparable to novotel. Been there couple of times and found that rooms at lower levels tend to be less nicely furnished than further up - this apart from the much better view / less noise pollution on higher levels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short-break for couples”
Reviews.Author: kylieonholiday
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for price - very modern, very friendly and helpful staff (english speaking), hotel is opposite a tourist bus stop, less than 5 minute walk to the metro station (Glories), 20 minute walk to the closest beach and opposite a large shopping complex (great for a quick breakfast). We had an amazing view of La Sagrada Familia from the bedroom which exceeded our expectations. We loved the bedroom design and how the bathroom walls were transparent (suitable for couples). Cocktails were great on the rooftop, but don't expect to swim in the pool. This hotel is ideal for a short break to Barcelona, staying in a great location just outside the busy centre.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance - disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jonesjabat
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Silken Barcelona at the the end of August for 2 nights. We obviously knew the location of the hotel when we booked but personally I feel it lets the hotel down. It is located next to the Torre Agbar which is a great sight but the rest of the area is very industrial and the hotel is actually surrounded by building sites. It is also at least 2 tube journeys to most of the main sites in Barcelona and a 5-10 minute walk to the station which is a little daunting late at night. There is not much in the immediate area except a shopping mall acroos the road which is quite boring but does have generic high street shops and cafes in it. On check in the staff were not very friendy, I don't think any of them actually smiled once, they seemed bored and uninterested. The lobby is very contemporary but it is a bit too much, it is very dark and the corridor to our room was even worse - it had no natural light and was like a nighclub with strange neon lights only! The room on first impression is quite cool and quirky but in actual fact its not very practical. It has a floor to ceiling window but unfortunately our view was just of grey drab buildings so not much point to it except for the light! The bathroom has a strange partition which moves and is actually see-through so there is no privacy at all whilst in the shower or bath. The shower head is placed to far out and soaks the bathroom floor. The bed was however quite comfortable and room has all the usual things needed, safe, TV, air con etc. On our first morning we were woken first by the maid letting herself in before 9am then about 10 minutes later by another male member of staff which was not the best seeing as though you can see the bed from the door! Also on the first morning whilst my fiance was having a shave the sink plug stuck and would not empty the sink so we filled in a form for repairs that could be left on the doorknob. We left for a days sighseeing and on our return over 7 hours later at 5pm our room had not been cleaned, bed not made, towels not changed and sink still full of dirty water and plug still stuck, even though the repair form had been removed from the door knob!!! However we rang down to reception and a rather grumpy repairman did come to fix it straight away. The walls are quite thin and must have beds back to back in adjacent rooms as on the second morning I was woken by the couples next door lovemaking!!!!!!! The rooftop pool area is a nice addition and has excellent views from it but the pool is very small for the space and on both days when we went up there all the sunbeds were taken. We did get the hotel for a very reasonable price and I must say you get what you pay for, if you just want a place to crash and are not bothered about the location then the Silken may be ok for you but we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: gc-traveller10
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern hotel! Central location - also right opposite a fashion shopping centre which includes ZARA, H&M and much more. cabs outside constantly and as they are cheap it is easy to get anywhere, close to Barceloneta beach. pictures say it all. would definitely stay here again. only downside is the swimming pool is quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Budget not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: AliBakes
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly reception staff, budget shot on lobby, rooms horribly dissapointing, pool unswimmable (thick with sun screen) and the sun deck stank of booze. Sheet ripped, blusher on pillow case that was 4 sizes too big for pillow and worst of all, some ones swimming trunks under the bed. So so dissapointing. The only good thing is the view from the deck and the close proximity of a shopping mall for affordable food instead of the over priced rubbish served in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible style at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Hilton954
Reviews.Content: I chose the Silken Diagonal for our recent visit to Barcelona based on other TripAdvisor reviews coupled with an extremely attractive room rate - we spent a week there and with taxes paid approximately 65 Euros a night. The rooms are attractively furnished and well maintained. Basically all I need to say is that I strongly agree with all the positive reviews given this hotel. I also want to mention two staff members, Pablo and Jesus who went out of their way to ensure that we had an enjoyable stay. There was free wifi in the hotel and if you are across the road at the huge Glories Mall, you can also access Barcelona's free wifi system - great for staying in touch with friends with WhatsApp on iPhone and Blackberrys. When we go back to Barcelona we will certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Surrounded by construction sites”
Reviews.Author: LiaX
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the new business quarter 22@, right next to the Torre Agbar and with really nice views of it from the roof terrace with its minute pool (no way you could actually swim there). There's a metro station nearby, the tram stops right in front of it, and there's a big mall across the street. So, you're out of the city centre but transportation options a good. It's a stylish hotel with many brown elements - that also make the dimly lit corridors really dark. The rooms are also furnished with modern design furniture. The windows cover one whole wall. But design was obviously more important than quality. It's next to impossible not to flood the bath room while taking a shower. Part of the equipment could need some maintenance. Breakfast is good, offering all the standards. What I really disliked was the unfriendly staff. They seem to thing that smiling is none of their business, and also talking is restricted to the strictly necessary. All in all, I'd say it's overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Best of all worlds!”
Reviews.Author: nate51
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it seems to give you a bit of everything. It's only a 25 minute straight walk to the beach, 4 Metro stops to the downtown core (very short) and you can walk to local sights, you have a large mall right across the street (Glories) that carries everything you could possibly need on any trip, also due to the location the local area is nice and quiet come bed time since you are not in a busy core. To those who do choose this hotel here are some tips... - The hotel offers free WiFi, all you need to do is at the front desk ask for it and they will give you 24 hours of use with a username and pass all you need to show is your passport, you can request multiple days also, so you do not have to keep asking. - There are mixed reviews about an inroom kettle, our room did not have one and when asked they were not able to provide one. - The sea food place beside the hotel covered by a wall (when you face the hotel it is on the left side) is the best seafood out there and it's really cheap. Bring an empty stomach if you love sea food you will be full and happy at the end. - We were worried about the lack of English speaking locals there but English is actually fairly common in tourist areas and even those who don't speak it will make a very strong effort to communicate with hand signals and pointing, they are very helpful and friendly there. But still try your best to learn a little Spanish if you can, to make things easier. - Pick pocketing is all the rave on the net for Barcelona but as long as you play it smart you won’t be pick pocketed. We never got pick pocketed at all. Just remember only carry as much as you need for the day on you, place money in a hard to access pocket or pouch don't carry a wallet in your back pocket. Hopefully this review will help you with your choice of a hotel, and destination. It was a fun trip and the hotel made it just that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very posh”
Reviews.Author: Undercover_Dragon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very stylish and up to date. We didnt stay in the hotel much with it being a city break we were only there to sleep. The rooms are very spacious and have massive windows that are in place of the outsie wall. By that i man where you would normally have your outside window in the wall, there was no wall it was all just window! There are huge electric blinds that cover the window giving privacy. If you stay at this hotel make sure your not shy around who ever your staying with as the bahroom doesnt offer much privacy with the dividing walls being seethough not frosted glass. We didnt have any food or drink at the hotel but did look at the menus. If you wish to eat or drink at the hotel make sure you've got a couple of quid! Not far from the hotel convieniently is a shopping area with several food outlets, supermarket, shops and an all you can eat chineese. Very nice hotel, is however a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great for ugly Americans!”
Reviews.Author: latrell1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silken Diagonal for three nights in a guaranteed Queen room. The Queen bed was as advertised and was reasonably comfortable. POSITIVES: The hotel's location is a little sterile, but it's certainly comfortable; it's within a five-minute walk of a Metro stop (Glories), and located within 300 feet of a Tram stop. Across the street is an enormous mall with a Carrefour supermarket and all kinds of shops, albeit mostly chain stores that you can find anywhere else on the planet. It's in a safe, sanitized neighborhood; I walked home each night ranging from 1 AM to 4 AM and felt totally safe. This isn't the sort of place you'd want to stay if you want a hotel you can stay within 10 minutes of, but it's a good base for you to travel and explore the city from. The room is decent-sized and has a nice minibar, but the real highlight is the amazing amenities kit that blows away any five-star hotel I've ever stayed at. They took the usual stuff and added a toothbrush and toothpaste, a shaving kit, and a sewing kit. I didn't visit any of the hotel restaurants, but there's a number of them on the premises. The staff here is excellent; I arrived at 8 AM and hadn't slept for about 36 hours, and while a room wasn't available when I arrived, the staff was happy to let me check in at 11:30, several hours early, once a room was made available. Everyone I spoke to spoke at least some English -- way more than my embarrassingly limited Spanish -- and a fair amount of the staff was totally fluent. NEGATIVES: The room's AC was pretty weak, and you had to insert your room card to operate the lights or the AC, so if it ever got particularly warm outside, you'd come home to a warm room. The shower/bath is in a glass sort of pod that's easy to see, so I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you're traveling with someone who you don't want to see you naked. Room service stops at 11 PM. "Free" wi-fi requires you to register with staff every 24 hours if you don't have an EU passport, and is highly erratic; paying a few euros a day for an account on the same network was far more effective for getting work done.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELENT CHOICE...”
Reviews.Author: bou_sta
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights during jun.Very nice hotel, with beautiful and modern decoration, at a good enough location close to the Agbar skyscraper (nearby commercial center, metro and tram station) and 15 min walk from sagrada familia and cuitatella park. Our room was clean, comfortable, the lounge and bar area were beautiful the diner not something special and the personnel very friendly ! Generally a very ''cost and value ''choice.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not great.”
Reviews.Author: dlynnsor
Reviews.Content: Silken Diagonal Barcelone (SDB) is right next to the Agbar (sp.?) "bullet" skyscraper and a Novatel. The "tram" runs down Avenida Diagonal right in front of the hotel but I'm not sure where it goes. Metro is several blocks away. Taxis are frequent. (Price to airport was $45 Euros.) SDB is ultra modern in a 90s sense which means dark, blacks, and grays. Prices for rooms varied widely--got mine thru AAA for a good price but others of my group paid MUCH more for the same or smaller rooms. My room was large with 2 huge floor-to-ceiling windows, 2 couches, 2 beds, a closet (BUT NO CHESTS OF DRAWERS), a safe, lots of options for lighting. No clock, no radio. TV with only one English station, plus one in French, one in German, and 3 in Spanish. A small window opened but noise from the street was then distracting. The BA was also large. The shower/tub was very high and quite dangerous to get in/out. NO shower door or curtain which then allowed most of the shower water to go on the floor of the BA. (There is a small half glass "screen"--like a stationary window attached to the side of the tub--that keeps some of the shower water in, but not much.) Beds were comfortable and bedding very fresh and clean. The a.c. was pretty good but neither the elevators nor the halls were a.c.'d, and they were VERY hot. Lobby, restaurants, and business center were a.c.'d. The room has a mini-bar into which one may put one's own food, however NO coffee/tea facilities in the room--VERY inconvenient! The "business center" consisted of 2 free computers w/ Internet and a printer. Dunno if copying/faxing was available or not. A GREAT inconvenience was NO PHONE MAIL (or messaging) in the rooms. For a hotel that tries hard to be ultra-modern, this was disappointing. Also the hotel did NOT change money, nor did I find a nearby bank. BTW banks are open only from 10-2 and close at noon on Fridays. SDB is right across the street from the large Glories Mall which has a food-court type area with reasonably priced cafes. Some took credit cards, and some did not. There is also a large supermarket in the mall but most things were packaged in large quantities. (They take credit cards.) Besides the hotel restaurants (which colleagues said were good), I saw no nice restaurants nearby. Two doors down was a 24-hr. pharmacy which was handy for several in the group who had minor hurts/ailments, forgot meds, etc. Very helpful staff but not well a.c.'d. The hotel has a LARGE wood deck on top of the building. Many people "sunned" themselves there but I was the only person I saw get into the TINY, freezing-cold pool. It was barely larger than king-sized bed. I've never been in such a cold pool, and I do a LOT of swimming. No possibility of actually swimming--too small and too cold. I chose this hotel because it was close to my business venue. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it highly. It was just OK. It was definitely NOT worth the higher price several colleagues paid for their rooms (most of which were smaller than mine).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BenjiBrown
Reviews.Content: went to Barcelona for a long weekend and as we like to relax and do some sightseeing we booked a hotel with a pool. The Silken was the only one within budget and reasonably near the Catalunya metro stop. It is 5 mins walk to the underground stop and it is 3 stops to the Catalunya station takes 10 mins. I found it fine and good distance to the La Ramblas area. We found the rooms very nice, modern and good facilities. The blackout curtains were great but noisy in the morning as we like to lie in sometimes and you knew it was 9am as you could hear all of the blinds going up. The bathroom is glass and so you can see in so ok if you are with a partner or spouse but if you are with a friend you will need to shut your eyes when they are in the shower as they only have a thin piece of material covering it. Obviously the toilet is closed off!!! The rooms had everything, hairdryer, spare razor, spare toothbrush and all toiletries needed. It also had a safe and a minibar! We never used the restaurant so we cannot comment. Across the road was a mall glories it was great and had a food court and coffee shops and restaurants if you just want a quick bite to eat. Staff are very friendly and pointed us in the right direction!

Reviews.Title: “Safe, convenient, comfortable: An excellent travel experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sucheslife
Reviews.Content: I made my first visit to Barcelona to attend a convention at Fira Europa. All the hotels close to the venue were booked solid and the downtown hotels looked expensive. I found that the Fira Europa was about 30 minutes away by subway. I was there for 5 nights and it worked out great!. The major tourist areas downtown are a 10-minutesubway ride from the Diagonal on the L1 line. I was apprehensive about traveling alone in Barcelona. My neighbor "lost" his wallet at the airport just last year. Practically every American I met there had a story about pick pockets. The Diagonal is away from the tourist areas and the neighborhood felt very safe. I booked one of the deluxe rooms which was more than enough space for 2 and it provides a second very large window. The room was large, modern, relatively quiet and comfortable. The shower was amazing: A large, modern overhead fixture with plenty of water flow. It also has a directional shower wand both in a glass enclosed tub. The beds were European - 2 twins side-by-side with down comforters - Firm but comfortable with plenty of pillows. Rooms have wireless internet with free and pay options. The free option is slow, throttled access. You can use it for email if you access your mail via a website. It was not sufficient to support Outlook. The pay version is 6 Euros per day and is as fast as what i experience in US hotels. The TV has 3 or 4 English channels. The hotel does not have an exercise room; however, it is located on a wide, flat boulevard that is great for jogging, walking, bicycling. There is also a health club but I did not try it. The breakfast buffet at 17 Euros is not cheap but it offers a full selection of hot and cold items. There do not appear to be any other breakfast options at the mall across the street. The staff was great: Polite, responsive and bilingual. As pointed out by others you don't pick this hotel for the view. It overlooks a construction site on one side and the mall on the other. But having the Glories mall nearby is a very good thing - Plenty of restaurants and a grocer right across the street. The mall is the gathering place for the neighborhood. Lots of families come to visit in the open-air areas in the early evening. It is a great place to people watch. This is a solid 4-star hotel for a -star price. A tip: You can reach the Silken Diagonal form the airport using public transportation. Either take the Express Bus to te end of the line and catch the "red" L1 subway line to the Glories station. It is about a 300 yard walk from there and the station has elevators to street level. The other option is to take the train to the Clot station and catch the L1 to Glories from there (1 stop). If you are taking a cab refer the driver to the Diagonal hotel at Glories. That should get you there.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel, Great location but take some net curtains”
Reviews.Author: Tue1
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel and stayed the first time I went to Barcelona. It's fantastically positioned to get to any part of the city by tram, tube or taxi. Rooms have great decor and spacious, great bar and a cool pool on the roof. No complaints at all except for the glass bathroom wall without any form of partition was a bit dodgy if your with your mates, no matter how much you like them!? Was nice to go to the roof top pool and watch some models doing having a photo shoot! *Great Bonus* Good complex across the road with lots of food places and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful experience”
Reviews.Author: Mechmeat
Reviews.Content: Usually I don't bother myself writing reviews unless the experience is excellent or, on the opposite, awful. I travel a lot and know what I can expect paying certain price range. I stayed in hostels and luxury hotels - so, I'm pretty much aware of the fact you can't expect the same services for the different cost of the stay. But in case of Silken Diagonal I was absolutely stunned, that is why I decided to write a review. OK, first of all - my purpose of Barcelona visit was Primavera Sound 2010. Choosing the hotel I took into consideration location and services. Due to the tough schedule I wanted to find the place where I can relax from the busy nightlife. And Silken Diaginal seemed to be the best choice - 4 stars, not far from the venue, close to subway station. First of all, when I arrived, the staff was not that friendly you expect from such a place. Noone brought wine bottle opener to my room, instead they suggested to go to the lobby bar and open it there. Not much privacy, I thought, but didn't care a lot. Lobby bar where I supposed to spend quite amount of time was really-really small with transparent windows to the street with construction work - didn't like it at all. OK, let's check the swimming pool, I thought. The stuff told me the outdoor one has been closed (?) and will not open until 31/05. They didn't have any indoor pool either. Not having a pool I went back to the room to take a shower - disaster! There are 3 taps (shower tap, bath tap and 'jungle rain' tap - don't know the right name). In any position of the switch water runs out of all 3 of them. Furthermore, the shower is separated from the room by transparent (!) glass, not even matte. OK, i stayed alone - but what if I plan to invite someone later? Tired of all those things, I opened the curtains (my room was on the 1st floor) and has been stunned by a construction site view all over the street. What a great stay I'll have - I realized. And wasn't wrong - the next morning I was so tired of the fest that forgot to put DND sign on the door. The maid came in at 12, woke me up, apologized and gone. OK, my mistake, no problem. But then they were trying to break into my room each 15-20 mins until I realized I give up my sleeping attempts and got out. And the worst thing I left for the last - the last thing you expect from 4 star hotel is an absence of the Internet. There were no cable connection possible, only Wi-Fi, which could be used both ways - paid and unpaid. Paid option I didn't try - I came for leisure, not for the business trip. Nonpaid - it gave you password for 24 hours, no e-mail checks possible, only web - and God! it was SOOOO slow. It took 15 mins to download file of 5 Mb. Can you imagine that in 21st century in 4 star hotel?! Me neither. It was the last drop I decided to write this review. So, to resume: the hotel might be good for a business traveller leaving the room early and coming back late, willing to pay for Internet separately (the advert told, if you pay it'll be much faster and allow to check e-mail - didn't try, however). The good thing it is really close to subway station and to a big shopping mall named Glories. For the ones willing to have a great time in BCN, I DO NOT reccomend this hotel by all means. It's too overpriced, missing some valuable facilities and a touch of vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunnysammargate
Reviews.Content: Travelled here in May. Very good hotel, 3 mins walk away from Glories Metro which is 4 stops into la Ramblas. Good stay no complaints, would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Entree into the Modernista concept of Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneDSebring_FL
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and son-in-law and I were looking for a 2 day respite to acquaint ourselves with Barcelona and recover from jet lag while waiting to begin a Med Cruise. We chose to stay at Silken Diagonal for the beautiful online photos and were not disappointed with the reality! The location was great...the hop-on, hop-off tour bus stops just outside the hotel, there is a great restaurant a block away in the Novotel hotel, the metro stop is a 4 minute walk down the street and was easy to navigate, and there is a very nice shopping plaza across the street which afforded us a pleasant diversion...as well as some great "Iberian" Ham Sandwiches at a wonderful "food court" where we also enjoyed a nice local beer...San Miguel. The ham rivaled any Parma ham I've ever had and the place was just right for an after sightseeing stop! When we arrived in Barcelona on April 23rd it was St. Jordi's day and we were welcomed into our hotel by the front desk explaining the traditions of giving ladies roses...which they gave to my daughter and myself. We were able to participate in the festivities downtown...on the Ramblas that evening. It was just three Metro stops from the Hotel. The hotel had a great restaurant also,...a bit expensive at 17 euros per person for breakfast, but I must admit there were many several choices, all good, and the coffee with steamed milk which they bring to the table in a large carafe was truly the best I've ever tasted! All in all, we had a great stay. The reception staff were friendly, spoke several languages and helped us out with a room change when we experienced air conditioning problems in our initial assigned room! The rooms themselves are exactly as they appear online and in fact were better than expected for the price! The shower was fabulous...a rain shower head as well as a hand held attachment. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lesleyman
Reviews.Content: Silken Diagonal Barcelona is a very nice and modern hotel where located just 5mins from Metro station. It's very convenience. A big shopping mall is opposite to the hotel. You could find H&M, Zara, Disney Store, Carroford supermarket, etc at the shopping mall. The neigbourhood is safe even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but location disappointing”
Reviews.Author: binmadrid
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip, and it was OK for the purpose - clean, modern, everything worked. But the views are of a building site or a main road,, and it is definitely not walking distance to the centre,which is a shame if you are visiting Barcelona for pleasure. I wouldn´t go back, there are hotels just as good in better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Good priced hotel in centre location”
Reviews.Author: bridget2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, got great offer from lastminute.com. Hotel pros - right across from Glories shopping centre - great for supermarket, shops and restaurants. 2 minute walk to Glories metro, 4 stops from Catalunya stop. On a safe street. nice friendly staff and free PC use in reception. Only complaint was bed is very hard did have sore back after first night. luckly for us hotel not busy but could hear person next door taking shower and putting down black out blinds but so tried from all day sightseeing didn't notice after the first day. Pool is tiny (fit 3 people) so don't expect much but sight from roof top is nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service with a few minor glitches”
Reviews.Author: thegoodluckclub
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Silken Diagonal Barcelona from February 26 to March 3rd and had what I would categorize as a very good experience. The staff at Silken is extremely accommodating and speaks English quite well. Although we arrived 3 hours prior to the scheduled check-in time, we were given the room keys without any extra charge. There is also free internet which you can access by getting a printout every 24 hours for the network name and password. The metro station Glories is very close by and only 4 stops from the city center. The room was clean and the design was very modern and chic, although it is starting to look a bit dated. We especially enjoyed the glassed-in shower and huge tub, and we didn't have any problems figuring out which knobs to turn to get the water to come out (I am going to guess that other Americans were probably the ones with those issues). Likewise with water getting on the floor-- if you stand in the part of the tub that is enclosed, there is no major leakage. The bed was very firm, so if that is not your thing, I'd go elsewhere; however, it was pretty large. The electronic blinds were cool. Remember, you need to put your room key into a slot to turn on lights or ventilation (we were a bit puzzled at first). Despite our overall pleasant experience, there were a few letdowns as well. The walls at Silken are extremely thin, to the point that you can hear your neighbors' bodily functions, conversations, television selections, etc. If you are not comfortable with this, do not stay here!!! We had the terrible misfortune to be next to a man who was not only sick and coughing loudly all night long for 2 nights, but also got ragingly drunk and was banging about his room like an angry elephant. I could hear him with earplugs in. Luckily we had 3 other nights there of excellent sleep to make up for it, and the front desk staff was happy to switch our room. Secondly, the view from the Silken is nothing special. Empty lots and construction. We weren't looking for some amazing view, so we were not fazed at all by this. Do your sightseeing in the center. Finally, on our second-to-last day there, something happened either in a room or in the 4th floor hallway, and I can only say that I smelt the worst odor of raw sewage or human feces that I have ever been exposed to, mixed in with PineSol which the maid had clearly used to cover it up. Perhaps a guest was ill, perhaps something was wrong with the pipes, I am not sure. But it was really quite foul. It resolved in 18 hours or so and that was all we ever smelled; luckily, our room was fresh-smelling as ever. In short, I'd probably recommend the Silken to young couples. It's very modern, hip, and fresh. If you are someone older with mobility issues, more traditional tastes, or a desire for more luxury, better to stay at a boutique hotel in the Barri Gotic (and pay four times as much for it).

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull room”
Reviews.Author: RoadtripNicaCosta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in october 2009 and loved the room. The style is modern but feels relaxed,The big bed was superb! We would definitely recommend it. We had a bargain also so check out if there are offer on their website. Enjoy Barca! Oh and the swimmingpool is indeed tiny. It didnt bother us..just enjoy the nearby beach

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: GabrielaM2
Reviews.Content: I went there with my husband and it was exactly what we expected. The service was impeccable, with all the people (from the lobby to the restaurant and room service) being very nice and polite. We stayed in a corner room, which we loved (the light coming in in the morning was perfect - the shutters work wonderfully to keep it out if you prefer). We stayed for 5 nights and was no more and no less than what we needed. In front of the hotel you have a shopping mall where you can shop or eat if you like. 100meters away you have a metro station which takes you everywhere in Barcelona, so the location is also perfect, allowing you to be in a quiet place (away from the noise and confusion of the center) and still be close enough to major attractions in the city (ten minutes from Sagrada Família or Picasso Museum).

Reviews.Title: “Efficiency with a smile”
Reviews.Author: 20thCenturyCox
Reviews.Content: My wife and I didn’t pay too much attention to those 10% negative responses as there will always be supercilious people that are very hard to satisfy. Of course, it’s also true things do not always run as smooth as they should and there are indeed people that have bad luck, just by being in the wrong spot at the wrong time. Things happen! Luckily, we weren’t that unfortunate. Having booked a Silken Club room on the internet for a not-too-bad price, we arrived at noon and could immediately occupy the room while our reservation form said the room was only available from 3pm onwards. The room was one of the most convenient we’ve ever had. We liked very much the floor-to-ceiling windows on either side of the room added a great sense of space to the room. The beds were huge, the wardrobes were sufficiently large and the safety box could hold a laptop or 2 SLR-cameras with a large telephoto lens. The table with 2 chairs was indeed more multi-purpose than a classic writing desk but I missed a desktop lamp when writing. I also missed tea & coffee making facilities which would certainly have made the room more homely. Regarding meals, we cannot say anything about the breakfasts but for your dinner, we can definitely recommend the Piano Restaurant on the ground floor. Of course, it’s much cheaper to eat in the shopping centre across the street – but there you only got McDonald’s or a greasy Chinese or Mexican eatery or the like and that’s no comparison. Quality has to be paid for! And as you can read in other comments, the hotel is conveniently located near a metro station. Oh, and don’t be too afraid of excessive noise of the construction site next to the hotel. The rooms are quite well isolated against noise. And if you don’t like a view onto a building site, you’d better stay away from Barcelona since quite a few of the important buildings are being restored now (e.g. Palau Nacional, Catedral El Seu, Basilica de Sta. Maria del Mar, Santa Maria del Pi, Palau Guell, Hospital de la Pau, and many, many others…).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: JadeyLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel is so lovely, we had a room on the 9th floor facing onto the town....amazing! we arrived on a good night as we had an amazing firework display right in front of our window which was very nice! Wouldnt suggest to go with someone that you are shy around as the bathroom is doesnt give you any privacy. Would higly recommend eating out as the hotel is quite pricy....there is a fabulouse chinese all you can eat buffet across the road in the shopping centre which is for €9 each! Very nice! If all you want to do is shop and eat and drink then this place is great for you......shopping centre just across the road and the town centre is 6mins in a cab down the road if you are looking for more upmarket shops...eg Gucci, Louis Vuittion!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bargain - would happily stay again”
Reviews.Author: Drewhuge
Reviews.Content: These reviews are always subjective, so I don't want to totally discount the experiences of the previous couple of reviews on here, but I couldn't disagree more. I got a pretty good deal for this place, paying around £70 a night for 3 nights, and feel I got good value for money. My room was scrupulously clean, and while I didn't have a great view, for the price that's something I could live without. I don't think it's the hotel's fault if it's in an area earmarked for redevelopment. The bed was comfortable, with plenty of pillows, and the electric blinds - 2 of them, worked fine and got the room totally dark, which I need to sleep. I'm sure the shower could be confusing - for the type of people who can't put the right shaped blocks in the right shaped holes. I'm no genius but I had it worked out in 10 seconds, and I rate that as a really nice shower. Sink stylish too, lots of great toiletries, which were replenished the next day. Nicely stocked mini-bar, but you're opposite a shopping centre with a huge Carrefour supermarket, so I'd recommend going there for any water / nibbles / Cava. I'd go over there for breakfast too, as it's a little overpriced at the SIlken. The restaurants look good, however, not that I ate there with all that the centre of Barcelona has to offer. I did have a drink at the lobby bar, which is actually reasonably priced, especially for regional Spanish wines, and I really like the lobby's look. Stylish without being unfriendly. Any complaints about the elevators are way off the mark. I never waited more than 5 or 6 seconds for one. You press the floor you're going to, and it tells you which of the three lifts - A, B or C - you need to get into. It arrives seconds later and you get in without having to press anything else. A nice touch. Staff were fine - I'm not a high maintenance guest anyway - but what I liked best about the hotel, apart from the stylish but comfortable room, was the location. I've stayed in the Barri Gotic, the Raval, in the Eixample, in an apartment, and liked them all, but Placa Glories and its station is only 5 stops to Placa Catalunya on the metro. You're in a quieter area, but still near enough all the action. It could do with stepping its internet game up, but the TV choice was fine. You're in Barcelona, what do you want to be watching TV for? Overall, I'd stay in this area and definitely in this hotel again. Maybe I lucked out in getting a clean room that worked, but as I travelled solo, I'm used to being shunted into bad rooms, and this was very far from a bad room.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gandmfam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the day prior and the day after a cruise. It was one of the hotels the cruise line offered with in their package. I agree with another reviewer that it wasn't like the pictures. Our first night we got a corner room on the fourth floor with a view overlooking the "bullet" and the Sagrada familia. The room itself wasn't very clean. The shower system is very confusing to operate, the water splashed all over and there wasn't anything to hold onto getting in and out of the tubs, not very safe. We were a little cold that night and trying to be energy conscious, pulled the comfortors out of the closet. They were both dirty and covered with mold. The motorized screen was broken on one of the windows. Breakfast was fairly good. Upon return from our cruise, we ended up with a room on the second floor, no view, dirty, the light bulbs in the bath were burned out, the toilet seat was broken, the stopper in the tub wouldn't pull up so we had to remove it in order for the tub to drain. The elevator system was very slow, the corridors so dark, you couln't see your door to insert the key. The lobby was supposed to be designed to look like a ship with an ocean theme. I found it to be dark and uninviting. We have travelled often to several countries and continents and this hotel makes it to the bottom of the pile.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Fidgetus
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked so good on pictures, but it was a big disappointment. We got a room on the 2nd floor looking at nothing else than a large building site (see pictures). We regretted not asking for a room facing the other way, until we later found out that there is an even bigger building site there. However, the main problem wasn't the view, but the noise from the building site that started around 7.45am and didn't finish till about 7pm. I know this is something the hotel can do nothing about, but it was the main reason why we wouldn't stay there again. The decor of the hotel was very modern and minimalist, felt almost Japanese. But the designer obviously put design over function. The shower/bath was good, but it was such a complicated system, so by the time we worked out how it works, we got showered with cold water. The electric horizontal blinds aren’t practical as they are very noisy. It woke us up each time someone in several rooms around rolled them up and down. And you have to move them up whenever you want to open/close the window. The hotel lobby looks like a prison deck on the Death Star in Star Wars - the one where princess Leia was kept (see the picture). Terrible and dark. For a hotel that was opened only 5 years ago, much of the furniture was already very dated. The white sofa chair was terribly stained, the towel rack ended up on the floor the first time we touched it, the toilet seat was loose, and so was the bath handle. The window could be opened only to maximum, and it rattled terribly whenever it got windy outside. The hotel advertises itself as a business hotel, but the internet in our room didn’t work. There are many TV channels, but CNN isn’t tuned properly, so all you are left with in English is BBC World and Eurosport. By the way, don’t expect the channels to be on the programs as indicated in the hotel book. The area is up and coming, good shopping centre with many restaurants just opposite the hotel. But if you wander into some of the other streets just east or north of the hotel, you feel like entering a Rio de Janiero slum. The hotel staff were professional but completely indifferent. The only person we got to smile back at us was the uniformed guard that was at the lobby all the time (…by the way, why a uniformed guard, is the area of Barcelona really that bad?) We didn’t try the restaurant as it is closed on weekends and national holidays (!!?) We ordered breakfast in the room only once, and it was a nice selection of pastries, ham and cheese. But we asked for it to arrive between 8-8.30, and it was delivered at 7.45 when we were still asleep. In general, not worth the 18 Euros. Positives? There were some. The bed was very good size, comfortable with nice duvets. The room was clean (except for few hair in the bath). The toiletries were good, although I cannot understand why the present you with things such as shaving cream, aftershave or toothpaste, but no hair conditioner. And the overall design of the room was nice, only if they thought about its function and kept it up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pkjpholmes
Reviews.Content: On the outskirts of town really, perhaps 20 minutes walk from the tourist areas, but 5 minutes to the subway. Very very modern design. Flatscreen tv (CNN in English), electric blinds, quiet and efficient A/C. Tiny pool. The restaurant was expensive and the shopping centre across the road was burger/sandwich bars so we planned our meals around our days out to save making additional trips into town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: rmgjr3
Reviews.Content: The location was great! The hotel is close to the Metro and across the street from a mall that has restaurants, shops and a supermarket. The staff was excellent and they offer complementary in room internet. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: micakxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Silken Diagonal last week and I have to say I was bit dissapointed. First there was some confusion with the type of bed reserved even though we exchanged 3 emails. We asked for room with some nice view and at the end they gave us the main steet room..Nevermind the room it self was fine but you could se some bits and pieces which were not in the best condition plus signs of previous leakage from upper floor (i could understand that after having a shower - it is hard to keep the water going inside the tub). I really liked the idea of glass bathroom although only ok for couples ; ) The service was not bad but the reception staff just was not really interested, so that was bit surprising. Only smile I got was from porter! Not sure if I would go back again although apart from what I expected I did not have a bad time in Silken.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, recommended”
Reviews.Author: ThisgirlLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silken Diagonal for 2 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. I booked through Expedia and got a good rate in combination with my flight. It is a very stylish hotel and I had a lovely corner room with great views. I read a lot of the reviews here before choosing the hotel and agree with some of the criticisms: that the beds are a little hard (but not that bad); that €17 for a continental breakfast +€5 etxra if you want something cooked is excessive; that it's virtually impossible not to get the floor wet when you have a shower & that the glass bathrooms would not appeal to some travellers (the toilet is behind a wooden sliding door though). I was impressed with the presentation and array of toiletries provided but I did think it unnecessary to have both a hand-held and an overhead shower in the bath, and it takes a little working out which handle on the wall controls the bath taps & 2 showers (be prepared for water to come out where you aren't expecting it to!). The rooms are well equipped, satellite TV but only CNN, BBC news & Eurosport are in English - they had film channels but these had been dubbed into Spanish rather than subtitled. It would have been nice if they had tea/coffee making facilities but perhaps they don't in order to encourage you to pay for breakfast in sheer desperation to have coffee first thing in the morning? There is a small fridge, jam packed with things you really don't want to purchase from the minibar but there is a little room to put things in. The staff were helpful and pleasant and the hotel whilst not being right in the centre of Barcelona is well located close to the Glories Metro which is only a couple of short stops from the centre (it really isn't that far at all when you look on that map). It is on a very busy main road but you shouldn't be disturbed by traffic noise unless you leave the window open - and you don't need to as the air conditioning works well, as do the 2 layers of blackout blinds which are controlled by bedside switches. The Sagrada Familia is only about a 15 minute walk away and it's very easy to get around by public transport to other tourist sights - buy a T-10 ticket for €7.70 which covers 10x Zone 1 journeys (quite a bargain I thought) on trains, buses, Metro & trams - I think all of the Metro system is in Zone 1 - as is the airport train stop. The shopping centre across the road from the hotel is quite large, has a lot of chain stores (Zara, H&M etc), the large Carrefour supermarket is particularly useful, and there are a lot of cafes and restaurants both in a courtyard downstairs and dotted around the mall including some well known chains: Subway, McD's (not open in the morning I noticed) Burger King, Starbucks etc. I chose to have breakfast at Pans & Company which is a baguette type chain as they have a good selection of pastries and small filled breakfast buns and they have a good breakfast offer of a pastry & coffee for €1.75, or coffee and 2 buns for €2.05 which given the hotel's €17 continental breakfast, is a bargain and the food is nice & the coffee strong. Overall I recommend this hotel and couldn't see any glaring flaws for the leisure traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Leisure not for Business”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell216
Reviews.Content: Rooms were good, smart & trendy. Good black out blinds. Good bathroom, powerful shower, although the floor gets wet everytime. Beds are comfortable. The internet in the rooms is a joke, worse than dial up. Wireless is charged for & only works in reception. No real business facilities and a less than helpful reception. We stayed for 9 days. The pool photo wasx taken from lying on the floor with a long angle lense, so don't expect to do more than job in & out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Debi-CO12
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel - I stayed with my 13 year old son for 5 nights - it is a modern hotel and in a good location - although not walking distance to town it is very close to the station and very easy to use the metro service. I did not at any time feel uncomfortable travelling around from this location and there is a shopping mall opposite. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were nice and modern - the only negatives were the glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom - not great for mother and son - and the small (and I mean small!) pool - think plunge pool rather than swimming pool!! But it was nice to have the option of a cooling dip on the roof. Oh and the bar on the roof near the pool was lovely of an evening for a night cap with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Definitely stay here!”
Reviews.Author: AYMAuckland
Reviews.Content: We were blown away with this hotel, considering it cost much the same as several other places of lesser quality we stayed on our holiday, it was definitely one of the nicest places. The location concerned me a bit when I booked it - however when we arrived we found it very simple to get around Barcelona from there and although every man and his dog warned me to be careful in Barcelona we never felt at risk (no more than you would elsewhere in Europe anyway). We walked home from the other end of the diagonal (1 hour) very late one evening after we missed the last tram and felt perfectly safe. The rooms are very modern and well equipped, the view of the sagrada familia from our room was fantastic. The rooftop bar and pool are definitely worth a visit & the lobby bar & restaurants looked to be very nice too - although we didn't get time to try them out. Definitely don't hesitate to stay here if you go to Barcelona - and if you can't get in here try the Barcelona Princess - our friends stayed there and we thought it also looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gooly2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near to Glories Station (Metro), which is just 20-30 mins ride from Espanya Station. There is a big shopping mall across the hotel (which has everything, including Carrefour, which is handy when we need to buy bottles of water). The beach is just 15-20 mins walk away and will go through various nice restaurant. There is also a very cheap seafood restaurant located just next door to the hotel. Alas we found out on the last day and we haven't had enough of the seafood. Everything was very satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ali27Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends in early September in a standard room. The room was really well designed - spacious and modern with a rainwater shower and comfy beds. The roof terrace on the 10th floor was stunning, with 360 degree views of Barcelona. The pool was very small, more of a plunge pool really, but nice enough to cool off in after sunbathing. The pool bar serves sandwiches during the day ranging from €8-€16 and drinks from €3 for a glass of wine through to €9 for cocktails. Location isn't particularly central, but the Glories metro station is only a 5 minute walk. We walked to the Sagrada Familia in about 20 minutes. Service was polite and professional - and we were given a complimentary check out at 1pm which was nice. We paid about £110 per room per night which was good value - I would definitely recommend this place for a short stay in Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aurelax2000
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed there for 2 nights. We had book one night at a really god price on Internet, but the second night that we booked on the spot at the hotel was more than double the price we payed through Internet. If I manage to find a good price I will defenitly go back but not at they rack rate price (In this case this is too expensive for what it his. The view from this hotel is the best that you will get out of it. The swiming pool is really small. The breakfast was good enough. The staff was friendly but not really helpfull on the touristy side. They should get a concierge in who will know what he is talking about. For a tip of advise if you want a cheap meal not far from the hotel, There is a fish shop just outside where you can choose the fish you want to eat, than bring it downstair and they will cook it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Week of Business in Barca”
Reviews.Author: scott_lboro
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel whilst at Cisco Networkers in January 2009. The hotel was quiet, clean and a nice environment. The breakfast wasn't really to my taste, but I am a fussy eater (I did love the pineapple juice though). The room was quite luxurious, I particularly like the bathroom (the shower was great). The network was slow (and no wireless) but it was better than nothing.

Reviews.Title: “We would definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: rjfxdmsm
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews that I had read about it. I read that it was away from the city but also that there was a metro stop near the hotel. There was and we found it to be very useful from the start. It was simple getting to the hotel from the airport. Bought one T 10 pass for my wife and I to share. Took the train from the ariport to Clot metro station. Then took the metro from Clot to Glories and we were right next to the Torre Agbar. Simple. You are only about 3 stops from the center of the city and it was nice to have a quite safe area to come back to after all day out. The room itself was very nice clean and modern. We had a great view from our room of the Torre Agbar and of La Sagrada. Within walking distance of the beach (15-20min) and there is a mall across the street that also has a grocery store next to it. We were able to save a lot of money by going here to get some simple items. Yes there is a glass wall around the bathroom so if you are traveling with children maybe not for you but for business or for couples I thought it was perfect. Keep in mind that star ratings in Europe are very different from the states. But this hotel exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great and convenient for overnight, forget about the rooftop”
Reviews.Author: Csabatje
Reviews.Content: We got a very good price for the room, very nice modern rooms, great bed, in general clean and nice hotel, everything you'd need is there. Location is also nice, easy to reach by public transportation or taxi, even possible to walk from downtown. The rooftop bar/pool was a minus, though. Went up on sunday evening to have a refreshing "swim" and some drink...There was some kind of open party with a bad DJ and strange people going up and down all night (people that are not hotel guests...a bit weird) so the atmosphere was absolutely not favourable for getting in the pool; we decided to get some mohito but then it turned out it ain't that easy - no it's not from the regular bar it's from a makeshift desk. No you can't pay there first get your "ticket" from the hotel personnel at another table. No you can't put it on the room, you need cash or credit card. Of course we were planning to swim, didn't bring anything up with us. All this for a small mojito in plastic cups (10 euro for one!). I never met a hotel bar where you can't put the consumption on the room, not in western Europe, not in Brasil, not in Romania. Additionally, the Michelin-recommended "piano"restaurant downstairs was...closed. (closed every sunday...in full season...hello??) Concluding, it's a great hotel to stay in Barcelona but find some other place to relax in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: travelsocial
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend last year and I really enjoyed it! It is conveniently located near a subway stop that will take you into the heart of the city in no time, and just across the street there is a mall with plenty of food chains to choose from. Even though the food chains are that close, we decided to order our dinner via room service. The food was delicious, however, very pricy. It's probably best to walk the short distance across the street and grab a sandwich. But all in all the hotel was very clean, modern and comfortable. I'd recommend it to my family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nesse_7
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Barcelona, close to the Metro and opposte a nice shopping center were you can have great breakfast. Nice rooms in a futuristic decor . I think this location is better then the noisy city center and only 10 mins away by metro. Clean rooms, but noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and cool”
Reviews.Author: Losviages
Reviews.Content: Personally I enjoyed my stay at Silken Diagonal. The hotel isn't the cheapest, but our room was spacious, clean, comfortable, looked cool with its modern decor and had everything we could possibly think of needing. A/C functioned properly and I couln't hear any noice from the street either. It is a four* hotel, so you do expect to find certain amenities, yet I still was positively surprised to find bathrobes and slippers placed in the bathroom. I suppose we had somekind of a superior room, but maybe the same things are available in all rooms. Only downside I can come up with is the location. Allthough Glories metrostation is very close, I would prefer walking distance to center and sights. Nevertheless, I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tokkie33
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days at the Silken Diagonal Hotel. Although the hotel is not located in the center of Barcelona, the Gloriés Metro Station is just a five minute walk away. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. Breakfast is served from 7 tot 11 AM. You have a lot of different things to chose from. Even cava if you want to. The rooms are spacious and look nice, although some handles in the bathroom were hanging loose. On the top of the hotel is a swimming pool. But in reality it is much smaller than it appears to be on the internet or in folders. Be very careful when you leave your room. Make sure everything is locked in the safe or your suitcase. A poloshirt was stolen from our room. Although the staff talked it over with the cleaning service, we never saw it back. Hotel Silken Diagonal has the potential to be an excellent hotel, but some minor annoying circumstances made it for me to be just a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, modern hotel and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Jem87
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Silken for one night with a friend and it was definitely an enjoyable stay! The hotel is extremely new and modern and not like any hotel I have stayed in before...it was a nice change to see something different. The room was gorgeous and spacious and very modern and classy. It was unusual to have a bathroom with glass walls but in a good way as it was something different and the room and bathroom were extremely clean and tidy. The bed was very comfortable and the room had a nice flatscreen tv. The hotel was located only a few minutes walk from the metro in a location not far from most attractions within the city. There was also a shopping centre across from the hotel with shops/cafes/restaurants. The pool area is very small however there is a nice view from that floor. I would definitely reccommend this hotel for young singles/businessmen/a city break. Excellent value and very reasonable and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting experience”
Reviews.Author: DeliDel
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel, located close to metro and tram station in the modern area of Barcelona. There is a shopping mall right opposite to the hotel where you can find anything you want. Next to the hotel is the Abre Tower, which makes it very easy to ask directions but also to find the way by yourself. The staff was very friendly and provide information every time we asked. The room was clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Smart modern tidy light with a little walk to town”
Reviews.Author: JohnCole99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Very smart layout, with dark hallway lighting. Rooms were very tidy, with full glass wall looking out. The rooftop pool is more of a plunge, but great to have a rooftop to relax on. Taxi to the old town was about 7 Euros...which we needed to do frequently. There's not agreat deal to do around the hotel. Though the beach is only about 15/20 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little bit to far...”
Reviews.Author: Coolced23
Reviews.Content: Nice place but it is not exactly what I was waiting for a 4star hotel... The view from the top floor (swimming pool floor) was nice. The bathroom was really strange for friends travelling together (no wall, only transparent glasses... :-S) The wooden ground at the swimming pool was a little bit old... But anyway this remains a nice 4* hotel but it suits maybe better to business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from town and awful see-through bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: StGeorgey
Reviews.Content: Can't really fault the interior of the hotel, but if you're away with friends wanting to experience the party lifestyle, then this hotel isn't for you. Handily located to the metro station but four stops away from the centre with no real trains running past midnight, which isn't practical if you're on a night out. As the hotel was so far away it wasn't worthwhile returning to get changed for dinner so had to stay in the centre all day, every day. The surrounding area of the hotel was pretty grotty with no late night amenities and completely inappropriate see-through bathrooms - which can't possibly appeal to the majority of their clientele. Reasonably priced but I would have paid more just to have had the convenience of staying in the centre of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Shaznpete
Reviews.Content: Along with 13 others we spent 4 nights at the hotel and didn't hear a word of complaint. Everything was as it says in the ad, bright, spacious, well furnished and spotlessly clean rooms, an excellent reasonably priced breakfast and a friendly, efficent reception made our stay thoroughly enjoyable. We were even given a free upgrade to a junior suite when reception heard that we were celebrating our silver wedding anniversary. Would most certainly use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Form over function but great all the same”
Reviews.Author: BigBlue1894
Reviews.Content: This fantastic hotel is all about form over function. It is undoubtedly the most stylish and modern hotel I have ever stayed in but unfortunately, some of the functions don’t work too well – the beautiful shower door leaks, the Jacuzzi bath doesn’t work and the touch screen computer in the amazing lifts give you the weather for February in the middle of April. Forget about all that though. The place is super. The rooms are great, the breakfasts are superb and the reception staff are all from the fantastically friendly Basque country which makes a pleasant change in the land of the miserable Catalans. You might worry that the location is a little bit out of town, but don’t. It’s just 4 stops to Plaça Cataluña on the Met and a short tram ride to the Olympic Village. If you do need to do some local shopping / eating there is a Centre Commercial just over the road. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen90
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. We have been to Barcelona twice before so know the city quite well. We wanted to stay somewhere that had links to both the city centre and coast and this hotel was perfect. Situated next to a tram line to the coast and Glories metro station which runs into the city. The hotel was modern and clean. We paid for an upgraded room and had a sofa and seating area which would make the room more comfortable for an extended stay. It has a reasonably priced bar and mini bar facility in the room but a way too expensive buffet breakfast at 18 euros per person. However you can get a coffee and croissant for 3 euros in the cafe bar in the hotel (or use the local supermarket and eat in your room). The hotel has a swimming pool on the roof and terrace with good views over the city-The hotel is located right next door to the Torre Agbar (the head office of a water company) which resembles the Gherkin in London and lights up at night. You also have good views of Mountjuic in the distance and Sagrada Familia approx 20 mins away on foot. The area is being redevoloped so the hotel is surrounded by building sites but to be honest we didnt really notice any noise. There are few restaurants in the local vacinity which is probably explained by the shopping area over the road as it has a food court where you can eat, mexican, chinese, italian, american etc. I wouldnt recommend eating in these as you could be anywhere but if you dont want to go back into the city, these are convienient options.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elnino_cph
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 7 nights. The service was impressive and the staff was quick and professional. The most impressive thing about this hotel is the roof area. Here there is a small swimming-pool, bar and a spectacular view of Agbar, Cathedral and the Beaches of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Modernist, Classy & right next to Torre Agbar”
Reviews.Author: CPFCeagles
Reviews.Content: Had 3 double rooms for single use. All pretty similar, clean, modern furnishings, power shower , well stocked mini bar. 1 room overlooked the spanish version of London ' gherkin' - fabulous but room had shower no bath. Other rooms on higher floor had no view of tower but bath as well as shower. 3 minute walk to metro and same for tram . Great access for public transport. Brought breakfast in shopping centre opposite as not good vfm in hotel. Cocktails gr8 and all 9 euro. Cabs cost an extra couple of euro if called by reception. Really loved this hotel. Tiny pool closed but great views from rooftop terrace. Will definately stay there again. 15 minute walk to Sagrada

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy hotel away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Basemess
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed out four night stay in this hotel located near to Glories Metro and next door to the Gherkin-like Torre Agbar. The rooms are very comfortable with all you could need on a city break - very quiet and peaceful (good soundproofing) and stylish. Its a very smart traveller experience!

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort”
Reviews.Author: yodayogi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Silken prior to our 5 night Royal Carribean cruise from Barcelona. The location was away from the major attraction, but the subway (Gracia) was around the corner and was extremely convenient to get around. From the airport we took a bus to Catalunya (8 euro for 2) and then a cab to the hotel which cost 10 euro. There's a strip mall across from the hotel, where they have clothing stores like Zara, H&M, and other Spanish brands and the french hypermarket called Carrefour. Euro was 1.60 to a 1 when we visted, so we shopped for basic food to save some $$ on breakfast. Their wine selection was quite large and inexpensive, with differnt selection of cava. We stocked up for our cruise there :). It's a great place to get gifts like Spanish Olive oil for family as well. The room at the Silken was very modern. I read the previous reviews and packed an extra soap/shampoo for myself, as they did kind of smell like male perfume. The bed was on the harder side but it wasn't too bad. I loved the rainfall shower, although you do need to be careful not to splash outside the tub. Overall with the money we paid it was a good stay. We booked directly through the hotel website and got a promotional rate $130 or so. Barcelona is a beautiful city so you're never in your room much! **Btw, one restaurant recommendation - "Cal Pep" in Ciutat Vella. This is a must!! They serve truly amazing tapas. The place is tiny and there will usually be a line outside, but once you're in, just order what you see others are having. There isn't a formal menu, you just sort of have to order by describing the dish. It's a culinary experience you will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: sunset61
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after finding reviews of it online and seeing some photos of it which made it look really boutiquey and different. I'd been to Barcelona before and was more than aware of the prices of the hotels on the Rambla and in and around that area and had heard that most of them are quite noisy all night with the noise from passing traffic, sirens and people. So, I took a gamble and booked one this one that was further from the centre but just a couple of stops from the Olympic village area and casino. It is about 20 mins walk from the central bus station and easily identifiable from a distance. there is a tram station right out front wihch takes you to the Olympic village and a metro station about 70 metres from the door that will get you into the city centre in about 7 mins. We had emailed ahead and told the hotel it was my birthday and so requested a corner room near the top with a view over the city. We managed a corner room about halfway up with a view that would have looked out towards the sea if was a bit higher! However, the room itself was great - floor to ceiling electric blinds, slippers and robe, his 'n' hers sinks and mirrors, bath and separate shower and great freebie toiletries that had everything you didn't know you needed and more. Great for us as we went with budget airline and only took carry on baggage! The minibar prices were also pretty reasonable and had a good selection of snacks and drinks. We also had a safe which was a real bonus for tickets and passports. You also get a hard back book with guides to Barcelona style and culture, maps, etc. Really useful. Only downside was the view of a building site outside. You can't help these things though - unless you are paying more for a guaranteed view, etc. The room itself more than made up for it. But, the best bit was the view from the roof terrace where the pool is. At night you can see the whole city lit up. You are right next to the 'gherkin' (like in London) and on our first night there is was lit up in every colour - really lovely. We had a filling breakfast every morning to set us up for our sight seeing. The staff were great and more than happy to organise us a cab to get back to the bus station at about 3am. They were happy to give directions throughout our stay and the rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: juleslovesal
