Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline at a rate of £460 so was not so sure where we would be but the hotel silken diagonal was contempory, and our bedroom was lovely. We went from the 28th dec 08 to 2nd jan 09 to see in the new year and we had an amazing city break. Barcelona is fab, we need to go back a second time to continue where we left off. The hotel is in a residential area next door to the Torre Agbar (the gerkin lookalike). We stayed in room 824 which was a corner suite that had amazing views across the city and the cathedral. Our room was modern and the bathroom was lovely, complimentary grooming kits etc...There is a minibar, electric blinds, a safe and a hairdryer. There was no tea/coffee making facilities which was a shame as the breakfast rate was 17 euro pp per day (exchange rate .97 euro - £1.00). The staff were always helpful but we did not eat at the hotel (quite expensive), there is a shopping arcade across the road which caters for all types of cuisine from lovely italian restaurants(we recommend Gino's) and Tapas bars to subway/Macdonalds etc...also supermarket and lovely shops. The way to get around from the hotel is the metro (underground) which we found very clean easy and efficient. It is only 4 stops to Catalunya which is the best stop for Las Ramblas and tour bus etc...Tour buses were crammed as the time of year we went but would recommend it as a brill way to see the sites. Park Guell is amazing, don't leave this out of your visit if you have not been, and near the olympic village there is a cable car up to a castle which is lovely and brilliant views of the port and the city. We spent new year at the olympic port which a row of lovely little bars and restaurants - a great night out! I was constantly put off by friends that it is a pick pocket nightmare but if you are streetwise and keep your valuables safe you shouldnt have any problems. I did not encounter any scary situations. Have a brill trip

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern”
Reviews.Author: Yiannis21
Reviews.Content: Very good experience. Very modern lounge and bar. Busy but quiet location. A good 4 star hotel but not really worth prices more than 130 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: genieCanada
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience (compared to subsequent Plaza Mayor in Madrid). Brand new, clean, excellent bathroom, good bed, fridge. The only trivial nit is that the water tends to splash out during shower on the floor -- yes, that's how good a hotel it is. ... But all other reviews say that as well already. A few extra comments on the location: Superb. 2 minutes walk to Metro with 4 stops on L1 line to Catalunya -- 10-15 minuts max. With the price of T10 being 7 euros and frequency of service, it's almost as good as being in the center, except you get brand new hotel in a newer part of town. Can walk safely at night along the Avenue Diagonal with other folks walking or biking down the center. Another major bonus is a large shopping center across the road. Don't want to pay for expensive hotel breakfast? We didn't, so we stocked up at Carrer Four supermakret in the shopping center for breakfast & lunches. Coffee? Can choose between Starbucks (filtered coffee worse than North America) or local Spanish outlets (excellent coffee). Lots of other eating/drinking establishments around the food court with outdoor seating area. Paid 107 euros a night (hotel web site, about 2 months in advance), which seems like a good value.

Reviews.Title: “great modern hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: nz7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, modern and in a good location. It is situated in a 2 min walk to the Glories Metro station on L1 (red line). To get to the hotel, after you exit the metro train, take the right exit of the metro station, turn left when you get out of the station, walk up the steps and turn right. You will see the tall 'gherkin' looking shape building and the hotel is just right next to it. Therefore, although the hotel is not situated in the heart of the old town/city, you can still get to it easily via the metro trains which is very handy. It really is only a 10 min ride to the center of barcelona. The hotel itself is really clean and spacious and modern. The only thing to look out for and be aware is the see through bathrooms in the rooms. If you are staying with a group of friends who aren't comfortable in seeing each other naked, then this hotel probably won't suit you as the bathrooms in each of the rooms are pretty much see through. Apart from that, this hotel makes for a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel has convenient rooms with complete facilities”
Reviews.Author: sandyguzman
Reviews.Content: During your stay at a Hotel Diagonal Barcelona you will certainly feel like you are in a private home. You can have a complete relaxation in whatever way you want. The hotel provides all you need during your stay. Services are really excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ejk21
Reviews.Content: Visited Barca in August with my boyfriend we got a realy good deal on lastminute.com for this hotel otherwise we wouldn't have been able to afford it! We both loved the hotel, very modern and clean. Has a lovely roof top sun deck with a bar and a pool (was a bit small). It was just a few minutes walk from Glories metro station a great way to get around the city. Not much going on in area around hotel but there is a shopping centre just across the road with shops like H&M and Pull and Bear, there is also a big super market which is handy for breakfast or a snack as food in hotel abit expensive for 2 students! Also only a 15min walk to beach. Would recommend and would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Chilled at Silken”
Reviews.Author: Soz1
Reviews.Content: Booked in May for girls only break-had been recommended hotel by colleague. Was a bit unsure after reading some of the reviews but needn't have worried. OK so it's not in the best area, 4 stops out on the metro from Placa Catalunya, 2 minute walk to the station but at least there was no 24hr noise (we bought a 10 trip card for about €7 which was morethan enough for 4 days). Arrived at 1pm and room not ready but no problem, we left bags and asked them to ensure a twin not double. Got back to hotel at 4:30 and were given, yes that's right, a double. Politely reminded them that we had been assured a twin at 1pm and were immediately offered upgrade to a suite at no extra cost - €76 a night for the room, great value. The hotel is modern, clean if a little clinical. The roof terrace was great for chilling out, loved the Buddah Bar music! Drinks a bit pricey, but hey - you're on holiday so chill! Room was great, funky glass bathroom, floor to ceiling windows, comfy beds, lovely squishy leather sofas. Word of warning-if you are travelling with kids be careful of the TV - some of the channels aren't suitable for under 18s!! If you're looking for something different, try the Jamboree Jazz Club in Placa Real (off Las Ramblas) great value and super live music in relaxed atmosphere, also Carpe Diem on the beach at Port Olympic - perfect for chilling and people watching. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend - absolutely!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the Silken”
Reviews.Author: mck9982
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business convention from July 5th - 10th 2008. The pluses of my stay were that the location of the hotel was pretty close to the convention center and there was a tram stop right across the street which really helped. I also utilized the hotel dry cleaning service and they were excellent. Other than that I think things were pretty average. The hotel's theme is simplicity and it really shows in the rooms. They are pretty small and basic. Really nothing special. Also, my TV was not working the whole time I was there. Also, the service at breakfast was pretty slow. I know that as an American I overindulge in coffee but after one cup they seem to think it should last you the whole breakfast. Good news for me there is a Starbucks right across the street. Overall just pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “stylish & great value for money”
Reviews.Author: romily33
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i have just returned from a four night stay at the silken diagonal between 30/07/08 and 03/08/08, we went for my birthday and we got a really good deal for the hotel on lastminute.com. the reviews on ta seemed very mixed so i was a little dubious and apprehensive about our stay but i have to say i / we were pleasantly suprised. as all the reviews state, the hotel is a bit far out of the city centre but there is a bus and metro and tram stop literally outside or a 2 minute walk away so the location really wasnt a problem at all. taxis are easy to get from right outside the hotel also. the location wasnt great, there was construction work going on right outside and the walk to the metro station was through a not particularly nice neighborhood with graffiti and shabbiness being the main problems, but it wasnt that bad.... what else do you expect in a major city?! the foyer and bar area are stylish and quite retro in the decor, the staff are courteous and efficient but i wouldnt say friendly. check in and out were painless and we had no problems there. we arrived early, around 2pm and we were able to check in then which was handy. we had a few drinks in the hotel, as expected prices were a bit higher than what we should have paid but not overly excessive. our room was on the seventh floor and was tastefully decorated, and was always spotlessly cleaned. we did notice that a room service tray stayed outside the room opposite us for two days though which wasnt great. room was cool, contemporary, spacious and comfortable, the floor to ceiling window was great although we had paid extra for a decent view..... we got a view of the construction site right opposite our building! the blinds blocked out all the light so they were great for keeping the light out and keeping the room cool, although you could clearly hear other neighbouring rooms opening / closing their blinds. the bathroom, or rather the bath / shower was poorly designed. the shower screen was not large enough to cover past the spray so the floor was wet after every shower. a few minor quibbles, but all in all a good stay and would recommend this as a great value for money hotel / trip!

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: clobella
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in July with my boyfriend and we were slightly disappointed. The hotel itself is quite nice however the view from our window was of a building site and also a ring road/motorway! We booked a double room but when we arrived they had given us a twin and the air conditioning did not work. However, they did change our room to a double with air con that worked so the staff were quite helpful. The picture of the swimming pool from the website looks a lot bigger than the actual size of the pool, it was tiny!! You cannot really walk to the centre from the hotel. It is a 5 min walk from Glories metro, but it is not a very pleasant walk (not dodgy, just not particularly nice!)The metro is only 3 stops on the red line to Catalyna so that was a plus point. At night it cost us about 8 Euros to get back from Las Ramblas which was not too bad. One night we walked back from Port Olympico and it took about 30-40 mins. All in all we did not have a bad stay as the room itself was quite nice but I would suggest to think twice if you want to be able to walk to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem !!”
Reviews.Author: pinkgizmo
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Barcelona after having spent 4nights at this hotel. I have been to Barcelonma before and stayed in hotel Jazz at top of La Ramlas and would say this is of equal standard but in a different location. The pros of the hotel were the hotel was very modern and had comfy beds and electric blind with a black out blind too. The pool area was nice and there were plenty of tables to sit at and have a drink in the bar area. Its across the road from a shopping centre which alos has a supermarket and a great footcourt with lots of outdoor restaraunts to eat at in the evening. You can walk to the beach in 15mins and there is only a 5min walk to all the lovely tapas bars and coffee shops which are m uch more reasonably priced with more atmosphere than being down la ramblas . Its a 5min walk to the metro and 4stops into town. The cons would be there is only 7 sunbeds at the pool so you have to be lucky to get a seat,but as nobody lies out all day you will get one at some point,also you can walk to the beach anyway. The hotel did not do any snacks up at the pool but then supermarket is across road anyway so can get your own. If you wanted to go to a pub or a restaraunt and eat drink and be merry you could till 2pm ish but if you wanted clubs or loud bars you would have to go to the centre. I have done both and stayed in both areas and I would say I prefered this as there was more local restaraunts which were cheaper and nicer,you could walk to the beach,shopping centre across the road,not so busy and for people watching at bars and cafes it was so nice watching all age ranges from the very young to the very old out enjoying a drink or an icecream and walking there tiny dogs,it felt like you really were on holiday !!

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: verymary22
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood for this hotel is under construction and buildings that remain show signs of blight. The walk to the Metro is dirty and graffitti is everywhere. The hotel itself is very modern but very dark. The lobby motif is dark simulated wood, brass, and silver discs. The hallways are dark shades of black brown and grey lit with purple fluorescent lighting. Rooms are also ultra modern and there is no ambience. Very disappointing stay-also a language barrier with hotel staff-we spoke english and knew no spanish-they spoke spanish and knew very little english.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious, no regard for customer service at all”
Reviews.Author: wonsoongi
Reviews.Content: I guess I can understand the positive reviews for this hotel. At first moment's glance, the Silken Diagonal is impressive. But the veneer doesn't last. My stay was altogether terrible. I overlapped my stay with seven other colleagues -- we all had separate rooms, but we all had similar experiences. In summary: -- I was not permitted to check in until 3:30. -- Three days of my five-day stay there were marked with a LOUD thumping techno party happening all afternoon and evening on the top floor of the hotel. When I complained, the hotel staff simply shrugged and said that there was nothing they could do about it. Apparently they rent out the space frequently for functions. During this time the elevators were unusable, as was the top floor. The swimming pool was strewn with empty beer bottles. Enough said. You should have seen the line at the reservation counter of guests trying to get their rooms changed to some part of the hotel far away from the roof. This, of course, was folly -- in fact, you could hear the rooftop party from several blocks away. -- My reservation rate was incorrect. They had a reservation rate that was 15 Euro higher. When I asked for documentation of this reservation, they conveniently said that they had "lost" the paperwork. I had also requested breakfast, but again, this was supposedly "not included" in the reservation. One clerk finally told me that he would take care of everything for me. Upon checkout, I found that none of problems had been cleared up, which required an additional 20 minutes of wrangling with another employee altogether. In the end I got the room rate that I reserved, but for some bizarre reason they would not let go of having me pay for just one of the breakfasts. Was it their pride I was hurting? They acted like infants and tried to wrestle a few extra measly dollars out of me, all the while knowing that they were probably jeopardizing any good will I had left with them. -- The elevators are an abomination. They are small, cramped, and have a completely dysfunctional and non-traditional call system. Expect long wait times. -- There is no wireless internet access in the rooms below the top two floors. -- In-room catering clean-up apparently only happens once a day. I can't tell you how many times I saw meal trays sitting outside my hallway left unclaimed for hours. Was the entire staff too busy partying? -- Most importantly, not once during my entire stay there did I get a simple smile or thank you from the staff there. They dress smartly with their tailored suits and play the part, but they seem to have no talent whatsoever for making their visitors' stays comfortable. The hotel is not in the most convenient area of town, but it's not in the worst area either. There is an eyesore of a shopping mall across the street from the hotel, but aside from that there is nary a single convenience in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. Good luck changing money, shopping for food or snacks, getting an after-dinner drink, or doing just about anything other than sleeping. (That is, if you can stand the noise from the revellers!) Yes, you can buy a drink at the bar downstairs in the lobby of the hotel at prices that are around 200% more than what they should be. In short: give this place a pass. Don't be fooled by it's fancy sheen. It is, in fact, a complete and utter nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, convenient, great service, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: yammi
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel within a stone throw from the subway station. Interesting elevators and nice decors in the room. Everyone was friendly and couldn't do enough for you. Loved the contemporary design. Couldn't believe we were in Europe when we paid only 120 euro a night high season for this kind of quality. You can't even get this in Asia anymore. A couple of minor issues. Free internet but it hardly work in the room. the glass door by the tub is a bit small so the floor gets all wet after shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Star1405
Reviews.Content: My rating is based on the value for money which was great. 4 star hotel, modern and funky design for the bedroom and bathroom. I have to say parts of my room were a little bit shabby. Rusty crack in my bath and paper coming off the ceiling - not a big deal but not great. Also to note the house keeping service - knocking on my door on both mornings at 9am, which was a tad early! Also the hotel staff weren't incredibly helpful or friendly and arranging a taxi through them was a bit of a pain as they would forget and leave you sitting there until you enquired when the taxi would show up! The hotel is based on Avenue Diagonal, a long street known for shopping and business. I would advise anyone wanting to stay nearer the centre of town to not stay in this hotel. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel but it does take around 10 minutes to get you to where you want to be. All in all an ok stay - think ill try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish little trend-setter”
Reviews.Author: Angus_Crackville_Jnr
Reviews.Content: Five mates and myself have returned from a weekend break in Barcelona where we harboured ourselves at the Diagonal. When you first step inside you are hit with the modern interior and beautifully laid out bar. The staff all very friendly and accommodating. Rooms very modern although for 6 blokes the see through showers were something of a revelation. Oh Gareth!! Erotic if you are on a romantic break but for 6 beer loving lager louts it wasn't something we overly enjoyed! Only disappointment being the pool. What pool? Oh... is that it? It is incredibly small. It couldn't realistically fit more than 3 people in there without you feeling very cramped. The photo's do well to enhance the actual size of it but when we first saw it in the flesh we burst into laughter. It was pathetic. Again, a very modern shape but could've done with being at least three times the size! All in all, a very good stay at the Diagonal. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LondonMegan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! When we arrived we were upgraded to a suite which was just incredible! the living room, dining area was huge with great views of the city and cathedral, the bed was surrounded by ceiling to floor windows with electric blinds, there was a jacuzzi bath and a wetroom shower. The whole hotel was ultra modern, sheak and stylish with pod chairs in reception and a nice bar in the entrance. The location was just fine there is a tram right outside and you can easily walk to Sagrada Familiar in about 10 minutes. There was so much to do in barcelona but it was hard to tear ourselves away from our room as it was so brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Quite trendy”
Reviews.Author: jojo_pink
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights from sun 13th April to the 16th. On arriving the hotel seemed very modern and stylish. It is very unusual and stylish but a little tired. The electric blinds in the surrounding rooms could be heard from our room and I agree that the building work going on outside is noisy BUT. . . . it has to happen so....!! The bath didn't work properly and flooded the floor and that was the same for the shower even though - they did look very stylish (just badly designed/constructed). I would say this hotel was of 4 star design but would probably only be 3star in the UK. We stayed in room 416 which was smoking and both of us are non smokers (only rooms left) which was very noticeable every day even with leaving the window open. The view was amazing from the roof terrace and even though it is a little out of the way you can access the Metro from a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Little Jem”
Reviews.Author: aimee-Jay
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my sisters 30th Birthday based on the reviews and pictures on TripAdvisor and I was not disappointed. As first timers in Barcelona we took a taxi to the hotel from the airport (Just under 40 Euro) - we got a three day metro pass from the Tourist Information Centre in Arrivals (had to queue for a bit though) We stepped into the entrance of the Silken Diagonal and my sister was already won over. The check -in was painless and the staff more than lovely. We loved the lifts and thought pressing the number from outside was different. We had room 826, a superior room and it was everything that I had hoped for, my sister loved it and described it as stunning! Bed and pillows really comfy As for the bathroom - yes it is a little see through and I did nearly drown myself having put the shower head the wrong way but hey we were on Holiday. The best things in the bathroom are a proper hairdrier and a magnifying mirror along with a nice selection of bathroom items. We did not eat in the hotel - but it was nice to know from previous posts that there is a shopping centre over the road which we used for Starbucks. Previous posts have commented on the surrounding building work - this did not bother us or spoil anything in the slightest. Other posts say this hotel is out of the way - rubbish!! 4 stops on the metro which is about 100 yards away and you are in the centre of Barcelona. We used the metro to go everywhere - it is fast clean and very efficient - puts things in the UK to shame actually!. We also used the tram (included on the metro card) to get to Port Vell which was great as we saw some of the outlying city - again very efficient I would say that the Silken Diagonal is in a fab location, is a cool hotel and is priced very reasonably, I have nothing but praise for it and I would definitely return again when I come back to Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel with some quirks”
Reviews.Author: ixion
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Feb 2008. This is a good clean 3-star hotel with some quirks, I would not rate it a 4-star. The entire hotel is designed in a minimalist Philip Stark style. The rooms are modern (almost too modern), but a bit cold looking for my taste. The hotel not in the best location for walking to sights or restaurants, but it is right on the metro and tram lines which are very convenient ways to get around Barcelona. The hotel is on a busy street and there is some street noise. Also, as of Feb 2008, there is some major construction across the street where a couple of high rise buildings are going up, this was noisy. The breakfast was good. The lobby bar is a bit sparse, but they do have smoking and non-smoking sections. The elevator is strange, there are no floor buttons inside the elevator, you basically press your floor outside the elevator and it tells you which elevator you need to take, once inside, you cannot change your mind or go back! I would recommend this hotel if the price is right. Pro: - clean and modern - near the Glories metro station - free internet access in the room (wired only, no wireless) - good breakfast Con: - ultra modern may be a bit too minimalist for some - not in best location - thin bed cover on the bed, not high end sheets - uncomfortable pillows - traffic noise

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: apras123
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at the Silken Diagonal. All the great tripadvisor reviews made me book this hotel. An excellent choice. We arrived at 9am at the hotel and got a room even without asking. The hotel is not in the city centre. But the Metro is right around the corner and takes you to Placa Catalunya in 10 min. We had room 907 and had an excellent view on the city. The staff was very friendly, professnional and helpful. Would go there again, whenever we are back in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Peech
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Silken hotels throughout Spain, so Barcelona was no exception. The Diagonal has a bit of "designer" feel while being reasonably priced. The bar in the lobby area is a nice place to relax and have a drink/smoke. The hotel is a bit out of the way from most tourist attractions, but it's near a subway station so it's still easy to get around. The rooms are clean and reasonably fitted like other Silken hotels. The bathroom has a glass wall facing the beds, with blinds for privacy. The maintenance of the bathroom could have been a bit better. The blue lights on the outer walls of the hotel are a bit annoying. You need to lower the blinds fully to go to sleep, and sometimes I like leaving the blinds open so I can be woken up naturally by the sun. Overall it's a reasonable place to stay in Barcelona. Since we didn't spend much time in the room, the reasonable price was more important to us.

Reviews.Title: “Silken Diagonal was amazing”
Reviews.Author: nishnish
Reviews.Content: The Silken Diagonal Barcelona was a must stay. Its a great hotel accoss the street from a huge mall with a starbucks! It was also 2 blocks from the metro (aka subway system). It was a great location. The hotel staff was great. no problems. Just be careful as they didnt mention that all their rooms have a see through shower, bathroom area. It is completely see through and that is the style of the hotel. For couples and single travelers its ok. But a bit odd for friends sharing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design, good service, minor problems.”
Reviews.Author: Big-Bang
Reviews.Content: The reason I booked this hotel is the cool design and the not-so-bad reviews the hotel has on internet forums like this one. I stayed at the hotel for a week and here are mine impressions: The good: Clean rooms, nice furniture, cool and inspiring design of the hotel. Friendly receptionists, at least the two persons that I have been dealing with. Free internet trough LAN-cable. (Availible at the reception for 20 EUR deposit) Phantastic glass wall with an outside view. Electrically operated curtains that block sunrays or curious eyes. Congestion in the sink - the personel fixed that same day. Armchair leg broken(!) - the personel fixed that same day. Very close to the subway and a big shopping place. Very close to the spectacular Torre Agbar - cool tower that can easily be seen from an airplane while landing or taking off. Great elevators. It is not possible to crank up the volume of the TV to very high levels - no disturbance from deaf neighbours. The bad: Very noisy road and a adjacent construction of a big building. Breakfast not included - in my country good breakfasts are included as standard. The view is so-so from some of the rooms. Mine view was not phenomenal despite I stayed at 7:th floor. Not very close to the centre of the city from the hotel, but possible to walk - approx less than 30 minutes. The floor of the bathroom gets wet when showering. No equpment to make tea, neither equpment to iron. The pool on the roof was closed - come on it was only October! :) Other: It is possible to see from the room in to the shower. This might be a problem for people with kids. Great for couples that find each other attractive, other couples beware. :))))))))

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, convenient, lovely rooms, generally good.”
Reviews.Author: SLdnMixedCpl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 3 nights at the diagonal via Easy Jet's own website. I was keen to see the hotel, as the previous reviews had left me feeling curious. In appearance, it is very stylish, very cool. Lots of modern decor and an upmarket feel to the place. I found the staff to be pleasant and generally helpful, although perhaps not at the pace that I am used to as a Londoner. The lock broke on our room one night as we were leaving the hotel to eat, and it took around 45 minutes for it to be fixed. Not a complaint really,more a small inconvenience. The rooms are very well appointed, ask for a view and you will get one. The Sagrada Familia is visible, and there is generally a good panoramic view of Barcelona. We were on the sixth floor and could see loads. The bathrooms are very nice, our bath leaked a bit but nothing dramatic, good toiletries. You are very close to the metro, you can be in the town centre in 10 minutes. We didn't eat in the restaurant, seemed a bit pricey, but there is the shopping mall across the road with a few different cafes and fast food joints for breakfast. So, would I recommend the place? Yes, but not at their listed room rate..if you can get a good deal..definitely. Oh, and the beds are a bit hard.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoegal1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Silken Diagonal for one night before embarking on a cruise. Taxi from the airport to the hotel was 26 euros and took about 15 minutes. The hotel is very modern-the lobby bar and reception area is lovely- 70 style chairs and furnishings, fab! Check in was fine- the staff spoke enough english to check us in smoothly. Our room was on the highest floor and although the view wasnt exactly picturesque, it was lovely having a huge floor to ceiling window. The room itself was modern and clean, with enough room to move around despite our two big suitcases. The only strange thing was that the bathroom 'wall' is a kind of frosted glass which means that anyone in the room can see you in the shower- fine if your staying with your partner but not so great if you were sharing with a friend or your mum!!We went up to the rooftop bar for a drink but as there was a private party going on we couldnt stay long. The view at night over the city was lovely. The hotel is located just outside Barcelona city centre- there is a subway station a 2 minute walk from the hotel and the tube only takes 3 or 4 minutes to get to Las Ramblas. There is a large mall opposite the hotel that has quite a few shops and several places to grab something to eat. All in all, a good hotel and I would return went next in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Staff help - hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: EODNurse
Reviews.Content: Agree with most of the reviewers - the staff's command of English was spotty.... some were great and others not so much. Perhaps after a two-week cruise, we were spoiled, but assistance seemed reluctant. 1 - The lights don't turn on unless you put your room key in a special slot - Were not informed - had to get the front desk to help. 2 - Directions to the Metro was vague, but there were signs on the way 3 - Requesting best way to get to airport via Metro was met with much confusion The Metro works well, but it takes about 3 transfers to get to the airport from this hotel. Additionally, the route to the underground was through a deteriorating neighborhood - lots of trash and grafitti. We decided that with luggage, it would be better to take a cab. The hotel arranged the cab and like a previous reviewer noted - about 30 Euros and 30 minutes to the airport. The rooms were futuristic. We really loved the double curtains that completely darkened the room. When we rolled them up in the morning, we were surprised how bright it was outside. They were very effective. The toilet has a door, but the shower is visible from the bed - just a skimpy curtain and glass. Not an issue for a couple, but a family with kids might have concerns. The breakfast was outstanding - well prepared, plentiful, and varied. Definitely not your typical continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, but far off!”
Reviews.Author: Cooki
Reviews.Content: The Silken Diagonal is a design hotel in a city that values designer style. However, although the lobby and rooms look beautiful at first sight, all you need to do is look closely to see the poor quality of most fittings. The first room that we checked into had a broken AC - the control unit was just hanging off the wall and all the electronic bits were missing. Although it took over half an hour, we were moved to a room that had functioning AC. Here however, the side lamps were dangling off the headboard! We decided to just live with that and not waste any more time... The Silken is located just next door to the Torre Agbar, a modern landmark which is certainly worth seeing. However, anything else that you might want to see it quite far off. Furthermore, this is a part of the city that is yet to see a lot of regeneration and the view from the panoramic windows is all but beautiful. The reception staff were a bit snotty and seemed annoyed at having to deal with the large number of people checking in. There was a large group there for an event and they seemed to be a room short. All in all, checking in was a rather unpleasant experience. If you are traveling to Barcelona as a tourist, this is probably not your best choice. You'll end up spending a fair amount of money on taxi rides in order to get to the more exciting destinations and you probably won't be able to get any advice from the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: BarcaRayleigh_Essex
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are spotless with a great feel of space. The corridors to the lifts from your room is like being in the twilight zone(awesome). The locatiion of the hotel is no problem, metro 3-4 minute walk(Glorias). And then about a 5 minute trip to Las Ramblas on the metro. Barcelona travel card is a great buy just hop on buses and metros all day and night without a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Barcelona break”
Reviews.Author: MichaelaCarlo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day stay at the Silken which was superb. Admittedly the hotel was more of a crash pad for us after a long day sightseeing, but in that regard it met all our needs. Location - yes, it is a little far out but we both love walking and exploring less touristy parts of a city, so it meant that we had a good twenty minutes walk at the start and end of each day in the more residential parts of Barcelona. (Cab to/from the airport is around 30 euros) Opposite the hotel is the Gracias mall which had a good range of Spanish high street stores - for example, Zara was bigger that the branches downtown and distinctly less crowded. We could therefore do lots of our shopping and only have a thirty second walk back to the room with our bags. Carrefour, the hypermarket, is also in the mall and was great for stocking up on water and fruit etc. Opening hours for the mall are 10pm-10pm. I wouldn't recommend the eateries around there as hygiene doesn't seem to feature highly on the list of priorities The rooms in the hotel were extremely comfortable, clean and functional. The best part were the blackout blinds which enabled us to sleep like babies. We found the hotel to be really quiet and we only encountered fellow guests briefly in the lobby. My only real quibble with the hotel is the pool - it's more like a small tub. The roof terrace is fab for sunbathing with an exceptional view over the city but the pool was far too small for swimming in. Sadly the hotel roof bar is only open on weekends which we weren't told about - a shame as its a great place to relax late at night. What else would I recommend for travellers - for food, go downtown. I have some superb restaurant recommendations - Taller del Tapas, Agua and 7 Portes are excellent. Also do rent a scooter on the waterfront. It cost us only 25 euros for the day and it was a superb way to see the city (really safe to zip around too).

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: belochek
Reviews.Content: very near to the center (metro station glorias), even though we bought a standard room thet upgraded us to the superior which was fantastic (2 big rooms and a huge bathroom) - the rooms are even better than on photos. The pool on the top floor is a bit small but there's the beach - so don't expect too much. The staff was very polite and friendly. I would stay there next time. Great for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Near everything.”
Reviews.Author: knez
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel with a great terrace with all day sunshine! The staff are a bit rusty in their English and the rooms are more "pretty" than of high quality, but all in all a very pleasant hotel. If anything is amiss they usually help out straight away and the cleaning staff is a sweet bunch. In addition you have a shopping centre with a food market next door, a beach three tram stops away and the centre is three stops by subway.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: claire0701
Reviews.Content: what a fantastic hotel! stayed for four nights at the end of july/start of august and was thoroughly impressed with the hotel. We had a fantastic time and were sad to be leaving. The rooms are exactly as you see on the website - we had a standard room and it was just perfect. I felt all of the pictures on the website were a fair representation, and we were even more impressed in real life. The electric black out blinds are great - never had a better night sleep, although we did sleep in every morning!! The room does not have tea and coffee making facilities or an iron which would both have been great. We ordered tea and coffee through room service and it was only 2 euros each so not bad. We also brought a travel iron or the hotel did offer a laundry service. We didnt get breakfast with our package so cannot really comment on that. We did get it delivered to the room one morning however, it was nice but i felt pricey at 20euros pp for tea and a croissant with some ham and cheese (we paid extra for the ham and cheese). It did arrive at the time we asked and the service for room service was always prompt and very good. Only had dinner in the hotel one night, restaraunt was quite quiet but the food lovely and service impeccable. Would eat there again in a minute. Staff were pleasant, some especially nice, other not so much but all in all they were very professional and helped us with any questions we had. Got talking to a few of the bar guys who are fantastic - Nicola and Miguel - they make a mean cocktail! The bar was reasonably priced also, 6 euros for a beer and a wine, with cocktails being 9 euros each. The terrace on the roof was our haven most afternoons. We would do a bit of sightseeing in the late morning and then head back to the hotel to lie by the pool and have a few drinks in the hot afternoon sun - was pure bliss! It was never too busy up there, and towels were provided which was a nice touch. Views of the sea were incredible. The only problem we could find (if we had to) with the hotel was its location. It is not a major problem but is a good 20 minute walk before you reach busier areas of the city. There is a tube station - glories, about a 3-4 minute walk away, or the tram goes right by the front door which makes getting around very quick and easy. We are hapier to be closer to the city centre restaraunts etc so would liked to have been a bit closer. The area is also under an awful lot of development. I think in a few years it will be in a great spot as there is so much being built around it. at the moment there is a great shopping centre directly accross the road with super restaraunts for breakfast, lunch or dinner around the bottom floor courtyard. Also a great selection of shops in here including a huge supermarket. There are cranes and building sites everywhere else though. This did not disrupt our holiday one bit as the blackout blinds blocked any noise in the morning, and there was no dust etc, it just meant that the scenery was not as nice as it will be when the works begin to finish. All in all, i absolutely loved the silken diagonal, it was modern, extremely clean and very professional. rooms were beautiful, it is very well located for public transport and within walking distance of the beach and busier areas for the city (about 20 mins) I would recommend this hotel to anyone and be sure that you would have a wonderful holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: marentis5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before a Mediterranean Cruise and enjoyed our stay. As other travelers mentioned, it's right next to a large cone-shaped building that's pretty cool. We loved being able to see La Sagrada Familia from our window! The rooms were very clean and the decor was nice. The bathroom walls are glass...but not the toilet (whew!)! Each room has one large bed for two people, so if you're traveling with 4 people, that will be two rooms. If you have three people, they do have some larger rooms with a couch that will accomodate that size group. The complimentary breakfast is phenomenal! There's a wide variety of fresh, hot food. Delicious fruit, eggs, meats, etc. It's all very good...even the coffee was wonderful! The pool is on the roof, which is unique, but it's incredibly small....SO much smaller than it looked in any picture we saw beforehand. Our kids didn't even want to go in it because they could tell that once they were all in, they wouldn't be able to do anything (there were 10 kids in our group). They didn't care about that though, we were there to explore Barcelona! It was easy to hop on the subway from the hotel (turn left outside the hotel and about 1/2 block up you go down the stairs to the subway) and see this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barcelona, not sure about hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flylove
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in April. Hotel was easy to find. Not located in the main city centre but within close proximity to Glories Metro station. Modern hotel, Nice decor, Some parts a bit worn considering it is a new ish hotel, Electronic blinds, good daylight block out!! Nice TV but not too impressed with channel choices. Rooms was smaller than imagined from photos on website, no iron in the room although there is a laundry service, room was clean every day If you are a tea/coffee lover you might be disappointed to know there no facilities to make your own cuppa in the morning!! A bit of building work going on near by but that did not bother us . Amazing views from the roof terrace but very small pool. Across the road is a large shopping centre, 15-20 min walk down to La Rambla personally. Staff On arrival I personally did not get that warm welcoming feeling however when making enquires staff was very helpful Bellboy was selective when I was on my own could not be bother to call the lift for me. On departure, not a word of thank you from Reception Staff. Food did not eat in the hotel Would I recommend this hotel? not sure, personally I think it is overpriced and the modern look will soon because old in a few years!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pyro2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this hotel in March 2007, and used it as a base to explore the city. The architecture and style of the hotel appealed to us, and the price was reasonable. Although it is not in the city centre, it is within walking distance of attractions such as the Sagrada Familia. Alternatively, there are metro and tram stops by the hotel, giving quick and cheap access to the whole city. The hotel restaurant is not cheap, so we ate many of our meals at the various cafes and restaurants in the shopping complex across the road from the hotel, popular with many of the locals. As a gay couple we were concerned about how we would be treated. However the staff reacted very normally when we booked in at reception, apart from checking whether we did want to share the same room. The room was good, with everything that we would need during our stay, including a little safe and a TV. The housekeeping was great, and it was a real pleasure to return to a fresh clean room each day. The hotel was not noisy, but I did get woken up in the middle of the night a couple of times by someone in a neighbouring room opening or closing their electric window blind in the middle of the night! Other reviews mention the shower cubicle - if you are sharing the room with anyone you do have to know them well! The toilet was more discreet in a seperate room. The view of the city from the rooftop is fantastic. You would also get to see the neighbouring Torre Agbar, which sometimes gets lit up at night. Overall it was a great hotel, and I would recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Served The Purpose”
Reviews.Author: slevy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. My husband and I came to Barcelona for an extended weekend and many hotels were unavailable for Saturday night due to the football game Barcelona played against Real Madrid. Hotel Silken seemed to be the only one available that was in our price range and met our criteria. It is a very clean hotel with a comfortable bed and pillows, great bathroom facilities, and a pretty view if located on a higher floor. The furniture is cheap and not taken care of very well for being a newer establishment. They provide shampoo and soaps along with other toiletry items and a hair dryer as well as a converter that is installed in the safe box. However, my biggest gripe about this hotel is the noises you hear at all hours of the day. The shades are mechanical and we could hear when those staying around us were raising their shades each time. Also, anytime someone is showering, the draining water can be heard. It sounds as if an airplane is flying overhead but it is the water! I'm a fairly heavy sleeper but this awoke me each morning. The staff was helpful to us each time we had questions. The location is good. Only 4 stops from Las Ramblas on the Metro and next to a shopping mall with eating establishments. For $200 a night I don't think it is worth it. My husband was not impressed at all. If you can stay here for cheaper then it is worth the price; however at $200 a nightI think it should be a little nicer. To sum it up, the quality is cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: tyty'smom
Reviews.Content: This is a realy nice hotel with excellent staff. Very polite, even when you are asking for directions to the same place 4 days staright!!! We stayed at this hotel for a total of 6 nights and had an excellent stay. Rooms were adequate in size, see-through glass in the bathroom was tres moderne!!! However not very appropriate when traveling with your fiance and your daughter. Very awkward for showering, but we made the best of it. The location is great, not entirely in the middle of everything but not far off either. We easily traveled by subway and tram to all over Barcelona. It is also walking distance to the mall and Gaudi's famous cathedral. Restaurant was pricey as was the room service. But check out the breakfast buffet. I think it was 15EU but well worth it and a great way to start the day. I would definately recommend and return to this hotel. I think we paid on average 120EU a night and it was well worth it.
